name: Carin Lake
text:
The room was clean. The doctor was good.
I went in for Anaphylaxis.
I arrived by ambulance and was stopped before exiting said ambulance by a guard wanting to check my temp and covid screen me. He commented my temp was elevated and dis not want to let me in. Medic told him I was in anaphylaxis. He backed up. I received Epi. Enroute to hospital but apparently no one was in much rush to give solu-medrol. Steroids.  Which I really needed.
I obviously didnt die but I definitely wasnt impressed.  The tech was wonderful, the nurse seemed to think very little of me.  Like I was drug seeking. Kinda made me mad when I got well enough to care.
Then we were handed discharge papers and treated like we were dismissed. I had to walk out without assistance or a wheelchair. I was stung on my foot. It was swole up like a Goodyear blimp. I didnt want to walk on my foot. But I wasnt offered a different option. The tech helped me when she realized I was hobbling and had no shoes.
All in all...if this wasnt the closest ER for me..I wouldnt recommend going there. But I didnt die so..yeah.

name: Michael Crowe
text: Once again into the fray. I had a Myelogram done at Image South in Birmingham they did an amazing job with very little discomfort of course they gave the usual possible side effects, one being a headache. I woke up the following day , Saturday, with a mild headache I took a Tylenol and thought nothing else of it. I woke up Sunday morning vomiting very dizzy and the headache was worse. My wife drove me to St. Vincent's St.Clair emergency room and she signed me in and we waited in the waiting room.  We didn't have to wait long until the triage nurse called my name and took me to check my vitals, and the is where competency ended. In all fairness the nurse that came into the room to take care of me was kind and polite. After waiting in the room a PA came in and asked the same questions that had already been asked and decided since I wasn't running a fever I didn't have meningitis and that I needed a CT scan. While waiting for the CT Tech to come the nurse came back in and gave me a shot of phenergan and Imitrex. I have absolutely  no problem at all trying the simplest medications first and I prayed it would work but it didn't. A while later and actual MD came into the room and said, "your CT is clear were going to let you go." I tried to tell him that my head still felt as if it was going to explode and he said call the DR that did your myleogram. I reminded him that it was Sunday and that I wasn't going anywhere until he did something. He left the room and never came back. In just a short while another nurse came in with a paper cup and some ice water. They gave me a norco and a prescription for ibuprofen. I would guess I sae the actual MD for about 15 seconds and the nurse that brought me the medication had a major attitude problem. I told the admitting nurse that I had taken tylenol ibuprofen and asprin already. We left the ER and I went home in exactly the same shape as I went to the hospital.  IF you can at all avoid this ER. I would understand if it were and I went in demanding narcotics.

name: JTF “Ty”
text: On balance, the medical services performed by the Nurse Practitioner were satisfactory, but the patient relations/customer service was lacking. I was in pain with a bad abscess and felt like I was an inconvenience to their Sunday afternoon. Further, after a few weeks I received a call AT WORK demanding payment for services rendered when they had not even finished the insurance filing or sent me any kind of bill or invoice. I told them to send me something via my personal email and I would pay it that night. Nothing. I called the next day and asked where was the email invoice? After being placed on hold for several minutes, someone came to the phone and said the bills would go out in the next few weeks. I expressed my dissatisfaction of being harassed at work to pay a bill that would not even be sent for another three weeks as it turns out. Extremely unprofessional and unethical business practices. All this over $66 I owed on my deductible.

name: Arnold Benedict
text: I had left a fairly negative review yesterday - although I did say that Dr. An and his nurses were good, and the reviews bashing them are unwarranted.  I had made two telehealth appointments last week, and neither time were they returned (I see a negative review about this below, so obviously I'm not the only person this happened to).  Finally, the front desk told me yesterday that they couldn't do a telehealth appointment for my prescription refills and that's why I wasn't called.  I was, as you can imagine, a little miffed.  I can understand if they need to see me, but you don't just "not call." - Let the person know why the telehealth appointment won't work so they can schedule to get in.  In any event, Dr. An personally called me this morning and was apologetic.  Their office has been overwhelmed, and I can understand that.  No place is perfect (I certainly am not, and I make mistakes too).  So - the personal apology goes a long way and speaks well of him.  As I had even said in my negative review, I've been seeing him for a while, and always liked him.  And, my experience with his nurses has always been fine, and I have found them pleasant.  One or two of the front desk staff can be off-putting, but most of them are fine too - and it's hard to find good help these days.  So, overall, I'm changing this review.  Yes, the situation last week (not calling me for my telehealth appointments and not even calling to tell me why, so I could get in) was not professional.  But, again, no place is perfect, and I appreciate the apology and the fact that they were overwhelmed.  Probably the front desk staff needs to be a little better trained and make sure to get back to people if a telehealth appointment is not met (by the Dr.).  But, again, overall, I have been very pleased with Dr. An over the years.  I had even said in my review that I would probably still give him/them another chance - and the personal call from him apologizing and then taking care of my needs and basically conducting the telehealth call right then - certainly corrected the matter, and speaks well of him/the place.  I always appreciate when someone cares enough about a complaint to call and try to make it right.  I'll be sticking with him, and can still certainly recommend him (and have recommended numerous people to him who have become his patients and have also generally been very pleased with him).

text: I have been using Vaughn Urgent Care for years. Each time I go back I am more disappointed with the service. Walked in and no one even bothers to greet you. I walked up to the counter and still not one word. I was sitting there for 45 minutes and no one even called my name. I understand they were busy but no one even speaking to you is ridiculous. I had went to the new Primary Urgent Care across the street from them first. I have heard several great experiences from people who have gone there. I went in and was greeted and with a smile. They didn't take my insurance which is how I ended up at Vaughn Urgent Care. I left Vaughn Urgent Care without being seen after it had reached a hour. I came back to Primary Urgent care and just paid out of pocket. I have no problem with the Dr's at Vaughn Urgent Care. Their staff is just rude and they need to fix it. I will not be going back.

name: Shane Wilkerson
text: I have used Vaughn Urgent Care many times in the past and was always pleased with service provided. So imagine my surprise when I was recently contacted by a collection agency for a bill. I was totally unaware I had any unpaid bill with them. This has hit my credit report in a negative way. Please make sure if you use their services you are paid in full. I always pay my bills on time. This bill was for around $100. I would have gladly paid it had I been aware. Needless to say I will not visit this establishment again because of their accounting practices.

name: Carrie Clark
text: I have to agree with another review on here... I have been going to this office for several years now, and each time I go back, I become more and more disappointed in the staff. Not one person smiled at me or asked me how I was doing- I was treated like I was just another body. I brought my ten month old in to see if she had yet another ear infection, as her pediatrician's office was closed due to it being on a Sunday... I was taken to the back with another patient, and given attitude when they realized my ten month old couldn't STAND for a weight check... finally they got her a pad to sit on, then was immediately told to go to a room, in which a gentleman had JUST walked out of. I questioned whether the room was even clean, and an assistant popped out and very rudely announced- "YES its clean... that is where I just came from... why is there a problem!?". I responded to her that I just watched someone walk out of the room while we were getting a weight check, and that I was simply asking a question. I do not believe that to be out of line. I have been in the medical field for over 12 years and have NEVER talked to a patient in response to their VALID concerns about whether a room was clean or not. I would have been fired on the spot if I had responded that way to a patient. I should note the room looked dirty...both trash can lids were left up and there was debris on the counter. The tech came back in to get vitals, which was un- successful because my daughter wouldn't sit still long enough for the monitor to work... so instead of changing the approach she just decided she would tell the doctor she couldn't get it done. Dr. An has always been wonderful- but did not offer an apology for the way his staff treated me- even though he witnessed it and made eye contact with me from his desk in the middle of the op floor. I truly believe any office is only as good as the staff they have working for them, and I hate to say I probably will not endure his staff to see him any longer. It doesn't take much effort to be kind and compassionate- two things the practice website claims they compensate their employees for being. If I was not totally desperate to get my baby an antibiotic for her ear, I would have asked for my co-payment to be returned and left.

name: Aggie Mae
text: The staff was friendly but I will not come back for a blood draw. There was no arm rest chair and 4 vials of blood were taken from my unsupported arm which made for unnecessary pain, and my arm is still sore today with a bruise. I'm not sure that the tourniquet procedure was done correctly either.  I've had this done twice before at another lab and never had pain or complications. Again, nice ladies but I will have to find another facility for blood draws.

name: Latesha L.
text: The reason you cannot get good service and treatment at this place is most likely because the staff are obviously too busy online giving this place 5 star ratings when it's not deserved! Do NOT go to this place if you are seeking a physician and staff who cares about your well being! Dr. An came into the room, looking like he was all doped up and about to pass out, asked me 2 questions and I never seen nor heard from him again. The medical assistant does not know to draw blood, sticking me 3 different times, blowing one of my veins which had my hand hurting and extremely bruised for over a week. I have filed a complaint. I have never had to hunt down a doctor to obtain my test results (CT scan, blood work and urine). I paid a lucrative amount of money for the services rendered at this office and feel like it was a waste of my time and money going to Vaughn Urgent Care. I could've and should've just gone to the emergency room because I waited just as long at this place, only to have the incompetent Dr. An come in ask me 2 questions and show zero concern or compassion for my health. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worse enemy if I had one. Go elsewhere with your health concerns because the staff at this place is absolutely horrific! If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Britlito Drillacat
text: This place was ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. The Staff was unbothered completely ready to check out and go home. Not friendly. The Doctor didnt even look at my issue and I'm pretty sure he doesnt even know what my issue was because you could tell he wasnt listening. They didnt provide me with ANY discharge paperwork and didnt even let me know anything about picking up meds in the end. This was TRASH service all around. Never again.

name: Gina Curvin
text: Must be nice when you can decide that you want to go home early and not to honor the posted hours. Arrived at 7:14pm on 9/12/19 and the door was locked. They tried to ignore me but another patient also walked up to the door. They came and said we're closed.  I pointed to the door with your hours which clearly says 8:00pm. She said she would have to check. She came back and told me the nurse practitioner didn't want to see any more patients and needed to leave early. So I asked are you able to change your hours without notice and all she said was sorry, she's not seeing any more patients. My last visit to your office.

name: Ashley Scanlan
text: STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!! The office staff is terrible, inconsiderate, and do not know how to tell time. I was tuned away at 7:15pm w my boyfriend who was running an almost 104 degree fever (which I made them aware of) bc the nurse practitioner was “really slow”. I was also told they closed in 30 min.... (that’s scary considering a nurse is supposed to be pretty good in math) There was no sign posted on the door or anywhere for that matter about them closing early. Just their normal business hours on the door “8am-8pm Mon-Fri”.

name: Ron Nesbitt
text: Dr An and his staff are competent, quick and courteous.  The wait usually is not too bad. The wait tends to be a bit longer right at opening time (8am).  You get into the treatment room and the doctor sees you in a reasonable time.  I have been here many times over the past two years for myself or for my teenage boys.  I highly recommend this Urgent Care facility.

name: Vikki Faulk
text: From the 1st call to visit ALL STAFF is very Professional!!  Dr An is the Greatest Dr. you can ask for!  He NEVER GAVE UP!!  He saved MY LIFE!! GOD BLESS

name: Gabriel Ramos
text: Very nice place. Nice staff. Were quick and didn't waist time but also were friendly and helpful. They most definitely deserve the 5/5

name: Dawn Whitaker
text: Great experience today. I have a bad ear infection and I came to Vaughn Urgen Care because their reviews online are pretty good. As a new patient I expected a long wait and lots of paperwork, but the paperwork was minimal and I was in and out in under 30 minutes. The doctor did not waste time. I told him my ear was infected, he looked at it and confirmed it is in fact a bad infection. He called in my prescriptions (antibiotics and medicated ear drops) then told me to feel better and sent me on my way. I like a doctor who listens to me and doesn’t waste my time. Very professional and kind staff. I will be coming back to this urgent care next time I need to see a doctor fast.

name: Jeffrey Young
text: If you've experienced the need for medical care while traveling, you know how uncomfortable it can be dealing with pain while in a foreign place. I've been traveling to Montgomery for work and had occasion to visit Vaughn on a recent trip. The staff and doctor were able to see me and provide me with some relief within a day. Everyone was very courteous and professional and also down-to-earth. I hope I don't need to go back but if I do, I trust I will be in good hands! Highly recommended.

name: Will Daniels
text: They are very friendly and efficient. I would highly recommend them over any of the other care centers. I was quite impressed on how fast they got me in and out. Awesome!

name: Laura Hughes
text:
Everyone on the east side of Montgomery LOVES Dr. An and his staff.  Get in --- and get out....That's the way to see the doctor!

Professional, courteous, and knowledgeable.  I always feel like I'm in good hands with Dr. An and his staff.

name: Carol Rueve
text: Very Professional staff. Always have wait time that is very reasonable to deal with. Would encourage it to all.

name: Rebecca
text: I sat waiting for the dr for 2 hours, he came into the room.... talked to me for 2 mins and left. No one popped their head in to check on me or even prep. I know Montgomery is slow, but that insulting! Communication, and my time should be respected. Unfortunately, here its not

name: BRYAN DARLEY
text:
Excellent care from Dr An and staff!
Highly recommend 😎👍

name: Colts Fan
text:
Very professional Dr An is pleasant to see. He really helped me get healthier!
Carey Bieber

name: Mocha Hotte'
text: I had an excellent experience at this facility. Dr. Ahn and staff were friendly and very professional. The wait time was not long at all even though there were a couple of people ahead of me. The office was very neat and clean. Most important of all, Dr. Ahn did an excellent job as a physician. I finally got the medical attention that I needed. I have already been recommending him to family and friends. Keep up the GREAT work everyone!!!😆

name: Joyce Smith
text: Quick visit Since i wasn't near my usual physician. Front Staff isnt so perky -but i understand. The LPN that administered my injections was outstanding! Personable and absolutely outfitted for the medical field.  (Hope you get through nursing!  Youre meant for it! ) and of course, the dr. Was completely professional and was kind enough to answer my questions. He explained what he saw and what it indicated.  He's just as caring as my primary care physician.

name: Lkshphillips
text:
The staff was great! The facility was clean with a nice atmosphere.
I will definitely consider Vaughn Urgent Care from now on.

name: Riketa Johnson
text: The EastSide Urgent care This place ruined my entire life how can a person come here and take a drug test for a job that they have had for a year and pass due to no drugs in their system but fail due to a small piece of the line where the temperature line is was not all the way shaded in is ridiculous. They black young lady was very rude to my husband he has a hernia mesh in his stomach close to his private area he passed why would you keep making him strain himself to use the bathroom for you then to watch him take his 2nd and 3rd sample what kinda of training is this. What kind of customer service do you people think that you are providing y’all ruined my life and I would like you to know that you made this man lose his job when he passed clear as day but hmm no proof because you know it’s all about who you get don’t know the lady name but she needs to be fired and lose her job too this place is for Caucasian people I guess because they treat black people here any kind of place here do not go here if your black especially I also want to know why wasn’t his urine sample sent to a lab as she said she would have to do this was never done lies and she needs her job taken away 2

name: k bobble
text: Absolutely the rudest person to take vitals I've ever seen... Complete with a door slam... Hoping the Dr is better...

name: Max Webb
text: Dr. An is the absolute best. I wouldn’t go anywhere else.

name: Heidi Casteel
text: Have always had a good experience here. Kind employees, clean environment, quick service.

name: Michelle B.
text: Doctor is very pleasant.

name: Mallory Camerio
text:
Long story short, Dr. An diagnosed me with a sinus headache. I did not have any sinus or chest congestion, runny nose, ear inflammation, etc. Even after I told him I knew it wasn't a sinus headache based on my symptoms (headache, fever, nausea, pain with eye movement), he was persistent in his diagnosis.

Turns out, I didn't have a sinus headache. I HAD MENINGITIS.

name: All Around Arbiter
text: I love the staff and the office.Everybody was kind,courteous and professional.Dr.An is brilliant!

name: Rebecca Ensley
text:
Great experience. The Doctor Thang An, Do did a great job. They saw me very quickly.  His nurse and the front staff were nice . I would suggest going again. I live about 26 miles away. It was worth the drive prattville urgent  care and pri-med could learn a lot.
Thanks for your service!!!

name: Lee Walker
text: Dr. An is the best.  Staff is excellent.  Love this place.

name: Daniel McQueen
text: very quick, sexy nurses , straight  forward doctor , all problems solved quickly

name: Dewey Whatley (UnrealMajor)
text: Do not waste your time going here if you have Medicaid they do not accept it

name: Jason Evans
text: Friendly staff and the doctors are great. Never a long wait.

name: Xris blonk
text: Great experience - everyone was so friendly and helpful.

name: Heather P
text: My experience taking my kids was fine, but I am frustrated by their unorganized and questionable payment process. Months after a visit, I received a letter stating I had 15 days to make a $20 payment before it would be referred to a collections agency and that they had sent 3 previous letters. I never received any of those letters. They told me to call them. I tried multiple times during hours that an urgent care should answer their phone and no one did. The letter had no substantiation as to why I owed the $20 in the first place. When I finally did reach someone, they told me to pay online or come to the office. Why the online payment info wasn't in the original letter is beyond me.

name: Jinsook Baek
text: Doctor is friendly

name: J R
text: I think this Doctor🙄 Divittorio, is one of the most arrogant and incompetent Docs in Mobile Infirmary which is saying a lot. This guy is the least successful medical professional on the planet with a survival rate of 0% of patients with COVID, unvaccinated, and on ventilator. His words, not mine. He seems to think that's something to brag about to his patients families. Essentially he isn't a doctor but just a caretaker to the afterlife. He is so arrogant that he will NOT pursue all avenues to improve the health of your love one. Then if you try to ask him legitimate questions he gets offended and is too busy to entertain such peasantry concerns. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion but i would not recommend this self described "loser" to handle your loved one.

name: Jean Helms
text: Dr DiVittorio was very knowledgeable and truthful with me about my condition. He treated me well and did not hesitate to refer me to a surgeon when it was called for. I would recommend him to anyone.

name: Jennifer Weil
text:
I wonder if the illustrious Dr. Adrian Divittorio has ever considered using his medical degree in a way that doesn't involve working with patients.  Probably should.  Adrian, if you are reading this, would you consider it?   You would save people the trouble and insult of coming in contact with your caustic temper.  You know, that boiling pot of anger that comes from who knows where, but bubbles over onto elderly cancer patients and their families when they ask about why the patient needs a certain diagnostic test.  That scalds people in hospital waiting rooms when a new growth is discovered and the patient's husband is trembling and being held by his daughter and almost crying, and you wait impatiently for a signature of consent with a look of disgust on your face, before insulting the elderly man when he doesn't consent fast enough to please you.
There are other pulmonologists in Mobile who actually like working with patients.  They care enough to ask questions, look you in the eye, smile, laugh, apologize when you have to wait, and look at your whole picture to ensure your best eventual health  (Here's looking at you, Dr. Virginia Radcliffe).  Save yourself the trouble folks - if you are referred to this questionable human, ask to be referred to someone - anyone - else.

name: Josh Cocoris
text:
Everything Kayla Corkan said is exactly on point.

I've never seen Dr's office be so horrible at communication.. just another example of how health care is going in a very bad direction, they act like the patient is offending them by calling and asking for some information.. they don't seem to understand every patient is a PAYING CUSTOMER (outrageous amounts too..) and should be treated as such. I'm sorry you chose to be a nurse for a doctor's office and have to deal with people all day, if you can't handle that maybe find a different profession.

You aren't the only horse in the race, maybe don't act like it? Your reputation is supposed to be more important than anything else.

name: Kayla Corkan
text:
I wouldn’t recommend anyone to this doctor, his staff is a joke! (I have never met the doctor to give him a review but his staff is lazy and hard to communicate with)

So here is my experience! My grandmothers home burned down to the ground Thursday (August 29th, 2019) I called the doctors office that day and wasn’t able to get a hold of anyone. I had a lot going on that day since her home burned down that morning around 4am. This includes me driving from Atlanta to Citronelle,Al! After a few hours of trying to figure out what to do I drove my grandmother back with me to Atlanta. Since they did not answer Thursday my plan was to call Friday! I called Friday and spoke to a nurse and informed her about my grandmothers home and her losing EVERYTHING! I wasn’t sure what medications she was taking and my grandmothers memory isn’t well! So I told her to prescribe her everything because it needed to be replaced. I also had questions about putting my grandmother on the patch and some other things. She said she would ask the doctor and call me back. The main item we needed was her BREATHING MACHINE!!! Well surprisingly nothing was done Friday! I called again Saturday and spoke to a young lady named Jennifer (on call nurse) explained everything again and what I needed. Jennifer did get a few medicines prescribed but the breathing machine issue was never resolved! I ALSO HAD TO CORRECT THE NUMBER the nurse before her added CVS number as the contact number.

So I had to call back Monday which was a holiday. I spoke to Sheena who was very helpful and called me back with every update! Nothing could be done since it was a holiday!

So today is Tuesday and I call the doctors office again to get a BREATHING MACHINE for my grandmother, Leslie answered the phone and basically told me it was my fault because they have been trying to call and there was no answer (no one called my phone) she also told me they don’t send prescriptions for breathing machines out of state! She laughed at me when I asked to speak to the doctor himself or to be sent to his voicemail. She advised me he wasn’t in the office 9-3-2019 and didn’t have a voicemail.

His staff doesn’t know how to communicate, they are lazy, and there is no way of leaving a message for him!

name: Cheyanne Dickens
text: He was the first Dr. out of five to find my narcolepsy.

name: Jamie Poland
text: The wait time to see a doctor is not good at all, although I know that they see many patients through the E.R.  People are in pain, sick, and hurting and I have to realize that it takes time to see each patient. After we finally got in after 10 hours, we saw a nurse for evaluation of symptoms, vitals were taken, and blood work was done. The nurse we saw was very nice, as was the doctor. More tests were done and I was diagnosed and sent home with prescriptions. Overall experience out of 5 was a three.

resp.text: Feedback is important to help us improve. Please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) at your convenience so we may discuss your review. We appreciate your time and hope to hear from you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

All staff was very polite on the evening that I attended. Couldn't ask for a better crew of what you had that night August 2nd 2021

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

The nurses were very nice and made me feel at ease. Catlin was very proficient. Dr Humphries was the ER doctor and he rates a 10. He listened and sought to find the answer to my problem. He made me feel at ease. As I said this was my first ER experience and when and if I need the ER again I will go to St Vincent's East and will recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We work hard to provide high quality care. And we are committed to delivering compassionate care to the community. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Harold Waldrop
text: Upbeat and humourous spirit  by all  employees kind and friendly,  very professional and informative with condition and a timely matter. Very impressive 👍. The term Emergency Room is fitting for the services

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Sabrina Ross
text: My daughter went in for back, neck and head pain from a car accident.  We waited in the waiting room for 4 hours. When she finally was sent to get an xray where after she waited in a room for 1.5 hours. No doctor ever came to see her, ever asked questions or looked at her. Im almost certain they forgot she was even there. We finally left the room to find somebody and ask them what was going on to let them know we were still here and sure enough 10 minutes later someone came back with papers saying she was done. Had we not walked out the room to find somebody to let them know we were waiting I'm sure we still would've been there a few more hours.  I know the ER has longer wait times than a doctors office but 5.5 hours just to get an xray without actually being looked at. Wow. The staff at check in were nice and helpful but that was the only positive of the experience. This was our first time at St Vincent's ER.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

text:
The emergency was real, the pain excruciating, the staff jaded and skeptical. No one wants to go to the hospital. When the staff doesn’t get your name right, tells you they would rather do anything but the profession they are in. Once they did the bare minimum to make sure death wasn’t imminent, they said adíos.

Not only did they half way bandaid the issue, but they left me in my room to find my own way out. Still in pain, still sick, just not completely dying. Even their diagnosis was a joke.

text: I had been experiencing abdominal pain for a couple of weeks and was concerned it was serious once the pain got more severe so I went to around midnight worried I had appendicitis. I was in an exam room in less than 20 minutes. I had a CT scan and lab work and was still out of there in less than 3 hours. The staff was friendly and helpful and the doctor was nice. They set my mind at ease.

name: Mike Rovnak
text:
I came in after a mountain bike accident for stitches and an x-ray. I was told the X-ray was clear and there was no break in my hand. I called and asked for a second radiologist to review the X-ray two days later as my hand became more bruised and more swollen. The second radiologist confirmed they couldn't even review for the part of my hand that was in the most pain because the X-ray cut that part of my hand out of the frame. Now I have to file a quality of service complaint and go have a second X-ray completed despite the fact that I clearly pointed out where my pain was and where the injury was on my hand yet they failed to properly X-ray that area during my E.R. visit.

Maybe focus on the quality of care instead of focusing on how fast you can get patients out the door.

It's unfortunate that I have to leave such a poor review because the doctor that stitched up my face during that same visit did a great job.

text: NEVER COME HERE. This place needs to be shut down. What a horrible experience. The second I came in, the EMTs relayed my information and one of the nurses just said "Really?" like she couldn't be bothered with my case. Afterward, they put in an IV but never hooked anything up. I asked for my family and the nurse said okay and then just left. I stayed there ALONE for 3 HOURS with no information. My machines had alerts, the room was blazing hot, and I was extremely uncomfortable in the bed but could not adjust it. I called the nurse twice with the button and nobody came. A custodian came in to take the trash and I asked her to please get my nurse. The nurse came in and didn't do anything to help me. By the time I managed to get another different nurse, I was crying and screaming every time I heard someone walk past the door just to get help. She finally helped me, as well as fetched my family. Only with the mention of a patient advocate did we finally get the things done that we needed, but not without attitude from the nurses and empty promises of things like seeing the doctor, who never showed up. Disgusting. What a horrible place. Someone could die from negligence in this place and they wouldn't bat an eye. Despicable.

name: April W
text:
My family is from Georgia and we were visiting Barber for the weekend when my husband started experiencing severe stomach pains.  The local urgent care suggested we visit the St. Vincent East ER for a CT scan/ultrasound to check his appendix.  As we were being discharged from urgent care, I looked up the reviews for St. Vincent and became nervous about visiting a hospital with such low ratings.

Once we arrived (on a Saturday evening), we were greeted by a friendly Registrar who checked him in and within 10 minutes we were called back to a room.  Within 2.5 hours, they had drawn blood, received the results, ordered a CT scan with contrast, diagnosed my husband with appendicitis, started him on antibiotics and began the process for him to be admitted with an appendectomy scheduled for first thing Sunday morning.

The nurses in the ER were very kind and attentive!  Always asking if we needed anything and checking in frequently with updates.

Once my husband was admitted to the 6th floor, we met Kim who assisted the nurse.  I cannot praise her enough for the wonderful care my husband (and myself) received from her!!  You can tell immediately that she has a pure passion for what she does, and the people put under her care!!  She knew I was going to stay the night and without asking, she requested a cot and provided us with extra pillows and even brought me a gown and comfy socks so that I didn’t have to sleep in my day clothes.  She was so courteous during vital checks by keeping the lights off and working quickly to try not to disturb my husband while he was sleeping.

Dr. Nguyen was the surgeon who came and spoke with me before the surgery. preparing me for what to expect post-surgery.  They kept him for several hours after the surgery to ensure everything was working properly as the anesthesia wore off.

When it was time to be discharged, my husband’s pain levels were creeping up and he asked for some pain medication before driving 3 hours back home.  He was told that he would have to stay another hour for observation if he took the pain meds.  At that point, he just wanted to get home and in his own bed, so he declined the meds.  The nurse was kind enough to call the doctor to get approval for one of the pain pills he was prescribed to help him get home in the most comfort possible.

Overall, I could not have asked for better care for my husband and would have no hesitations recommending this hospital.

text:
Husband came in for chest pains.  Was taken back any given an EKG, blood drawn and sent back to the waiting room .   6 hours later, never called back .  When he checked with the desk they said 4 more ambulances had come in that took precedence .   Others in the waiting room, who has been waiting 7+ hours finally gave up and left to go to another facility.  Understaffed.  Uncaring.
We will never use this place again .

name: Brieanna Bradley
text: Horrible horrible. Treated like trash and talked down to. Don't come here it's not worth the time.

name: Monique McQueen
text: If I could give a 0 I would they're awful I sat in the waiting room from 5 to 2 in the morning, wasn't given any pain medicine didn't get my results for my urine, blood work or cat scan. They told me the doctor has left for, the night I wouldn't recommend this hospital to anyone.

name: Mark Calvert
text:
On Saturday, 9 September, 2017, I fell on a sidewalk and badly bruised my ribs.  I had this same injury almost 20 years ago and was fairly confident that this was the same injury.  When I had this injury previously, I went to St. Vincent's Occupational Health Clinic which was on U.S. 280 at that time and the physician told me that it was CRITICAL that I breathe fully with sufficient expansion of my lungs (which would cause some expansion of my rib cage and the accompanying pain) to prevent the risk of developing pneumonia.  At that time, I was about 30 and in good health and I was prescribed Hydrocodone APAP 10 (mg?) and that worked well.  I had very little pain when breathing or sleeping and recovered within a couple of weeks.

I'm now about 50, about 60 lbs heavier than I was then, and have been unemployed for a while but I'm attending graduate school to attain a Masters degree to teach science at the high school level.  When I visited the ER on the 9th not long after the fall, I received the same diagnosis of bruised ribs, the same warning that I must breathe fully to prevent pneumonia, but then was prescribed 500 mg Naproxen (same thing as Aleve) and a muscle relaxer.  The medicine was almost useless as it was only moderately effective for only about half the period that it was indicated.  I was still not breathing properly and had intense pain for more than 50% of the time.  The pain affected my breathing, my sleep, and my ability to concentrate on my studies.

I called my primary physician (as ER instructions indicated), Dr. Jack Zaremba, after a couple of days and told his nurse that the medication wasn't effective.  They stated that I would have to come in for a visit before they could DECIDE if I needed something stronger.  I had just paid probably $100 on a copay for the ER along with the cost of the useless medication and now they wanted to suck some more money out of me before they could DECIDE if I my excruciating pain was worthy of some effective medication.  I refused.  The ER had already diagnosed me and erred in prescribing medication, so why should I have to pay more money to get an effective prescription?

I'm sure that the opioid "epidemic" is affecting the judgement of physicians so that they are hesitant to prescribe certain pain medication, but due to their monopoly on prescribing certain types of medication, they have a duty to make sure that they prescribe sufficient medication to their patients.  The only reason I went to the ER is because I remembered that stern warning by that physician years ago about the risk of pneumonia and I expected that they would prescribe something that would actually help suppress the pain so that I could comply with their instructions about breathing.  By merely calling my physician and requesting more effective medication, they've probably added me to some DEA list of pill poppers.

After three weeks, I'm noticing just a slight change in the level of pain which I experience.  I don't think that I'm breathing fully yet, but I don't seem to have contracted pneumonia yet.  I'm just using over the counter pain meds which are just as useless as the prescription meds were, but I see no reason to return to a physician and help them with their country club dues if they aren't going to do their job to relieve my suffering.  The next time I go to the ER at St. Vincent's East will be involuntary and via an ambulance.

name: Jashay Valaza Gragg
text: Worst! I sat there for 4 and a half hrs while having breathing problems and they repeatedly called people before me. Then the receptionist had the nerve to get smart with me after I asked what was taking so long.

name: Shamika Brown
text: Nobody in the emergency room and still couldn't get a room. Employees and security guards talked about no job related stuff instead of attending to the patients. Im hurting badly and no onen seems to care.

name: j Newby
text: what an JOKE...8 1/2 hours for blood test, x-ray and scan....most dis-functional and not caring place we have ever seen...WILL NEVER GO AGAIN!!!!!

name: Jamaya Tucker
text: Told me their weren’t accepting anymore patients in the emergency department.

name: Ridisha Murphy
text: I hate this hospital ER they are slow and will put people who came hours after you to the back this will be the second time I walked off with my child they will make a child wait longer than adult I think they should close the ER

name: Sharon Jones
text: I loved this place when Dr. Vaughn was my primary doctor. He was wonderful. When he left I was referred to another staff member. My comment and question is their anyone in charge that I kind speak with about my experience with the new person. Their are some issues that would like to express. I someone does respond thank you on advance.

resp.text: Sharon, I'm sorry to hear that you had a negative experience. Please call me and I will help any way I can. Greg Waters 205-547-3901

name: Buckshot (BK)
text:
I’ve had two bad experiences with this health provider main May 2021 and august 2021 I needed blood work results for severe abdominal pain! I left multiple messages for Dr Felgner to get my blood work results. I was unable to get a call back after leaving some 7 messages within a weeks time. I even went into the facility to get the blood work results but I was turned away and told that Dr Felgner world have to give them to me!  What is a patient to do?!!! I even filled out a records request, but I never received my CAT Scan & Blood Work results!!!

Stan as far away from this facility. Dr Felgner seems to be very compretent, but his staff at the Lakeshore location are completely incompetent!!!

They absolutely have not interest in the wellbeing of Dr. Felgner patients!

In 2 separate situations, I left 10 messages in the third week of May 2021 and then in the first week of August 2021 I left 8 messages for inquiries about my blood work. Both times I never get a call back. I had to make an appointment to talk directly with Dr Felgner!!!

The most recent situation, I was having to live with severe abdominal pain. The doctor told me to call him if the pain continued. I did, but no on would return my calls. I ended up having to request my records and go to a doctor to researched on my own. I was told my records world be ready for pick up in two days. It has been 8 days and I have yet to get my records!!!
I had to pay for new blood tests out of my pocket because MedHelp would not release my records!!!

I have retained an attorney and filed complaints with the Alabama Medical  Board. No one should have to fight with a medical facility to get help!!!

Stay as far away from these evil people!!!!!!!!!

name: Kendra Brown
text: I have always  had a wonderful experience from this clinic. Cynthia at the front desk always greet me with a smile. When I ever call with a question all of staff get right on top of it. Dr. Felgner has been one of the most caring and loving doctors I've ever had

resp.text: Thanks, Kendra!

name: Emma sandoval
text: They don’t answer the phone, some of the staff are extremely rude. They don’t call back with results for the labs. Honestly safe yourself the emotional uproar they may cause due to the lack of response, an unwillingness to answer phones to get basic information..

name: Mark Asperger
text: A spreadneck, covidiot anti-masker owns this place.

name: Nathen
text: The nurses say they will submit your preauthorization and never do. They tell you they will call you back and never do. You can't leave a message because the voicemail is full. The doctors are good though.

name: Tanya C
text: My husband needed a bunch of tests done for his work and in a rush turn around.  We called many clinics to get help but the only one who greeted us w kindness and went above and beyond was Med Help.  From Angel P who was very helpful in finding out if they could do the tests we needed done in the time frame we needed to when my husband got to Med Help having Haley making the process as simple as possible and quick. To Dr McFaden being kind and understanding. We cannot thank Med Help enough for helping us. We know it was a  unique situation and very grateful for all their help.

resp.text: Thanks Tanya!

name: Darius Conner
text: I had a wonderful experience with the young lady Ayanna who helped me. She brought me and answered every question that had. I was in and out in less than 15 minutes with everything I needed. Very professional and knowledgeable. Please give this young lady a raise!!👍 great experience

name: Colton Spain
text: Drove 30 minutes to get told they stop testing for Covid at 6 PM and you can’t ever get the front desk for help no matter what phone number you call. Not surprised at all.

resp.text: Please visit our website and complete the online form for COVID testing. Thank you for choosing MedHelp.

name: samantha stephens
text: I came in super sick and no other place was offering me any answers. I came to Med Help and they were so kind and considerate, despite my difficulties regarding needles. Robert and Alyssa specifically were so professional and I would 100% go back.

name: Spencer Wilson
text:
I have to say that my visit today to the Medhelp on Lakeshore was one of the better experiences I have had at any quick care type of doctor's office.
The person on the phone who initially booked my visit, the nurse who administered the test, and the doctor who followed up with me after my test results came back, were all great. I'm sure MedHelp like all other similar doctors offices are overwhelmed right now, but these guys were extremely professional and made the process much easier than several other similar quick care facilities I visited recently.  Great job MedHelp in Vestavia!

name: J A
text: I be could NOT be more disappointed (disgusted) with the POOR quality of treatment my 19-year old daughter (student living away from home) received  at this clinic. Multiple visits, multiple tests, lack of action and follow through. The last issue being a failure to update her medical records which resulted  in delays in receiving prescribed medication. With little to no help from this location in resolving. No way I’d ever refer anyone to this clinic. Awful.

name: Ms. Cyd Bailey Howard
text: I have seen several doctors at this location. Never had any problems. Dr. Thayer Moore joined the staff in 2020 and she is very unprofessional and refused to listen to her patients. She just prescribes meds, meds to wake you up and meds to put you to sleep. I attempted to voice my concerns about all of the meds she prescribes and I received a certified letter saying that Medhelp will no longer service my medical needs. It’s Very important to listen to the patients. When I left the office the very last time. She had sent 12 Prescriptions to Publix for my diabetes and high blood pressure. Completely unreal and very unprofessional. Run away from that office if they schedule you with Dr. Thayer Moore. I have concerns that she may have some agreement with the pharmaceuticals company’s. Everyone else there has been acceptable.

resp.text:
Ms Bailey asked me to put my medical license at risk and I declined.
I am saddened to see that she decided to retaliate by making slanderous and false remarks online. I hope she finds some peace. Dr. Moor

name: David Paden
text: I've gone here several times over the years and have always been impressed with the quality of the care received.  I've also taken or sent family members and they also have been happy with the service.

name: Mell Rose
text: Ok so when I first got here I was disappointed I had some things too do and the process slowed me down . They did however correct the situation . It was okay

resp.text: Mell, we do see that you were the first person seen this morning and that you were seen quickly. We apologize for not having change, but we are glad to have provided you with excellent care.

name: Martha Bath
text: I had an experience that I needed help with the finance department, the person that stood out to me was Kristi McAdory!!!!! She took my need serious & she really helped me, she had the BEST attitude!!!  Very caring, kind & helpful!! The world needs more Kristi’s💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖💖

name: Casey Gewirtzman
text: Several people have already commented about this, and my experience has been the same. I had a really bad sore throat, and I went in hoping to get an antibiotic or something. I was told I needed a COVID test, even though I already had COVID not long ago. I waited an hour and half. I had to call multiple times to make sure I got tested, because they clearly forgot about me. Plus, I was also supposed to get a strep swab, and they forgot about that, too. I’m never coming back here again.

name: Emily Butler
text: Tried to get tested for Covid. Sent telehealth form as instructed by website around 1:30-2 on a Wednesday. After sending form, instructions said I would be contacted by a nurse to setup curbside test. No one called. Thursday morning I tried to call telehealth line and site I had requested curbside test. I only got voicemail. Left a message explaining situation, and just requested someone verify they received my info and I was in line to be called for an appointment. This was around 9 am. It’s now 4:25 pm and still no response. In the meantime, I went elsewhere to be tested.

name: danielle aaron
text: Jada and Sabrina were AWESOME on 2/25/21. Highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Thanks Danielle!

name: Erica Scaife
text: I went in on 12/26/20 because I was having sinus trouble. I explained to the nurse what was going on with my sinus. He told me they had to do a covid test I said okay. I told him that was fine but I needed to be seen about my sinuses. The nurse told me once they get the results back from my covid test the doctor would call me so to leave and they would contact me. So I never saw the doctor. An hour and half passed and I called them the lady that answered told me I was negative for covid and the flu. I said okay what about the symptoms I came in for. She put me on hold and came back to the phone and said the doctor would be calling me. I never received a call and I get an email saying it was filed on my insurance. But I never saw the doctor and in turn had to make an appointment to see my doctor. I am very disappointed in the service I received or should I say did not receive. While I understand being careful and not wanting to get other people sick this process was not right and I feel like how can you charge me if you don't treat me. I will not be visiting this facility again.

name: John Dorsett
text: All the staff was very helpful, cordial and led us thru this procedure effortlessly. This is a great group of people who took good care of my loved one. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks, John!

name: Mohammad Firouz
text: Very polite staff and nice service

name: Marla Dean
text: I have never had an experience like I had there today. Was seen by a female physician by the name of Moor i believe. Will never go back. Hopefully, the other physicians ask questions before they start talking about your history.

resp.text: Marla, we hope you feel better soon and wish you the best of luck in your search for a new provider.

name: Kimani Evans
text: Firstly the staff here is phenomenal. They go above and beyond to ensure that you are getting the very best care. I dealt with the “African American doctor from OKC” (pardon me for not remembering her name) but she was very understanding and patient. The nurses were very well trained. My only recommendation would be to develop  more private way for patient to describe their Symptoms at the check in desk. Other than that I was very  impressed.

name: Jason Williams
text: Wonderful. Kind. Professional. Efficient. Very impressed.

resp.text: Thanks, Jason!

name: whitney dillard
text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you're unhappy with the service we provided. Please give us a call so we can better understand your frustration. 205-547-3901.

name: Melissa Snyder
text: Please note that if you go to Med Help in the evening or weekend, you will be charged a non-advertised $44 night/weekend clinic charge. This is charged despite the services being marketed as "urgent care." They don't seem to use the actual urgent care billing code and use primary care code instead. I'm assuming to make more money and later charge the extra night and weekend fee. If they would advertise honestly, I would not be so upset by this. My specific grievance is with the Trussville location, but I'm sure this is a company-wide practice.

name: Christine
text: Dr. Bernreuter was excellent - very thorough and went through all the treatment options.

name: PJ Albano
text:
Drs Vaughn and MedHelp Administration:

I literally felt like the proverbial train hit me, and  was being beyond a wimp.  After labs, rapid flu, & CXR , Julie Phillips, MSN, CRNP, and her NP student Christina Ray, RN, doing her clinicals) were probably the nicest and most caring providers I've ever come in contact with.  The two of them and their support staff went well above and beyond taking care of me today.
I've been in the medical / pharmacy field, physician relations for well over 20 years, and they're simply  top notch.  I know you probably get, albeit completely undeserved, complaints of some nature from patients, so I thought I'd drop you a quick review and say GREAT JOB, GREAT HIRES, GREAT MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS... I'll be transferring my records from to MedHelp as soon as possible.Thank you again...PJA.

resp.text: Thank you, PJ!

name: Charmaine Perry-Livers
text: Very nice greeting when I entered the clinic. Clean and free coffee! But the service I received from the Doctor was excellent! I recommend this place to all that have Urgent Care Needs!

name: Valerie Rodgers
text: If Dr. Smothers is there, go somewhere else.  Don't get me wrong, he was a really nice doctor but he is VERY slow.  Walked in at 4:50...didn't leave until 7:10.  There were four people in the lobby in front of me & I saw 2 people come from the back.

name: Mallory Edmondson
text: Both my husband and I went in last month. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the doctor was great! We were in and out within an hour!

name: Jose Cortes
text: Excellent environment, the Dr. associates are very helpful, fast to do their good job, and the Doctor is great, perfect to visit by anyone, is well recommended.

name: scott gamble
text: Dr. Felgner wasn't there for my scheduled appointment and they didn't call me or send me any notice via the online portal so I showed up and had to leave or come back 4 hours later for a different Dr.. Don't waste your time coming to this place.

name: Frank Lloyd Bite
text: This place is truly the worst. Super rude and judgmental doctor and staff. Will definitely never go back.

name: rebecca smith
text: Just went in for a check-up. The staff was very friendly and my appointment was quick. Dr. Orso was friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. All together I was only there for about an hour! The waiting room is really nice too: spacious, well lit, with drinks, snacks and coffee dispensers.

name: anita brunner
text: Nurse Pam was a wonderful nurse to work with! She was very knowledgeable and answered all of our question with confidence!

name: Dallas Carroll
text:
Dr. Smothers ran blood work, flu and streph test all of which came back negative. I had a horrible headache and and a temperature of 102.8. He did no additional testing and came back into the room and said, "You're not going to like this, but I think you have a serious infection- meningitis! You will more than likely need a lumbar punture or spinal tap."
He recommended that I go to the ER, but dont worry his medical assistant to offer the ER a heads up that I was coming...
After waiting countless hours at the ER and NUMEROUS TESTS I had a viral infection. All of which required fluids, ibuprofen, and lots of rest. I will NEVER return here. Apparently telling someone -after running a handful of tests- it's perfectly fine to tell them that they most likely have one of the most UNCOMMON and RARE infections. He didnt even ask if I was vaccinated as a kid- which my mother made sure I had every vaccination know to man.

name: Lauren Brady
text: Front office was friendly. I didn't wait long. Doctor was knowledgeable and kind. Doc sent meds to 24 hour pharmacy and I was on my way. Great experience!

name: Christopher Anderson
text: I am out of town on business for a few weeks here in Birmingham, and needed an emergency refill. So I walked in here to see if they would be able to do this for me, and I was promptly told they were not able to do so by the front desk without actually consulting the nurses or Dr. On staff. So I went down the road to another urgent care and got my prescribtion refilled within 10mins. So yeah, terrible service, do not recommend.

name: Marty McArthur
text: You can either make an appointment or just show up.  Those with appointments go first, of course, especially if they allow "first available doctor," but I have never had a horribly long wait, even during flu season.  For convenience, there is a complete pharmacy on the premises.  I believe the pharmacy closes at 5:30 or 6:00 PM.  I have never been displeased with a doctor or a staff member there.

name: Ross Carpri
text: I went to this site per my Doctors instructions to have blood work done.  They refused to do the work because they said that I needed an appointment and was not allowed to work on me since my primary doctor was not in that location.  Thank God I didn't have an emergency or they would have probably let me die right there on the lobby floor.  Very bad service and the two employees were not compassionate in the least.  I won't  ever go back.  I'll take my chances somewhere else.

name: Reed McMullan
text:
MedHelp is the worst example of a medical establishment. I can't even begin to describe the worst medical experience I have been through. I took my wife to this MedHelp after she was recovering from the Flu, because she clearly was not recovering. Dr. Solomon Saul has the WORST bedside manner of any physician I have ever met. As he began to look at her symptoms, he kept shrugging them off. He said, "your symptoms are general, so I'm not sure why you came in." He continued to verbally harass her and question her symptoms. After he sat in silence staring at us, he finally said, "I guess I can prescribe you something for your GENERAL symptoms." What a jerk!

To top off the whole experience, I wrote to MedHelp's Facebook page, hoping for a different, friendly customer service experience. Boy, was I wrong! After not even receiving a reply, I followed up. I have posted the conversation below. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT use this medical company for any service.. They do not care about the patient, not care about the medical betterment of their PAYING customers. What a rip-off.

name: Cats Mcc
text: I'd been here multiple times for urgent care issues, usually respiratory infections, and they've always been very fast and nice! I recently decided to establish with a new PCP and became a patient of Dr. Felgner, who is extremely nice and really cares about his patients. He's very kind and actually talks to you instead of over you. I'm in and out in less than an hour, even with urgent care problems after 5:00. From the front staff to the end of your visit, everyone cares about you and I've yet to meet a rude person there. I can't recommend Medhelp Lakeshore any more highly! Great people giving great care! --Liz M

name: Walter White
text: Friendly staff and knowledgeable doctors. Needs more Auburn stuff in pharmacy !

name: Juju Vyez
text: Avoid at all costs! The doctor I saw for my back pain was nice. The lady at the desk said they'd send a bill if anything was owed. Nearly a year later and not a single bill received, and I find myself dealing with a collections agency due to their ineptness. I wish I'd suffered through the back pain. It would have been far less painful than getting dinged on my credit report and having to clear that mess up.

name: Gabrielle Hernandez
text: They were very quick with bringing me back and I was in and out right away. Exactly how an urgent care should be.

name: Gene Floyd
text: Recently drove myself here with chest pains. As I walked in there was a sign that said they handled "heart attacks". I walk in, tell the lady at the desk I thought I might be having a heart attack. She replied that they were full and couldn't get to me. I looked at her and asked for her please to check that I was in a lot of pain. She finally walks into the back and then comes out and tells me again that they were too busy I would have to go elsewhere. This meant I had to get in my car and drive to Brookwood, where I ended up having to have a stent put in as I had blockage. Needless to say, I wouldn't take my ex-mother-in-law's dog to this place. I mean what kind of people, especially at a doctors office would tell someone having heart pains to go somewhere else without even offering to call an ambulance?

name: Andre Campbell
text: Thank you for your great service would highly recommend medhelp to any one and will definitely go back for any future needs thanks to Beverly bridges and your wonderful staff for your care and compassion....

name: Olivia Stiles
text: I had a great experience Tosha the nurse was the bomb dot com at giving shots. I had a great experience.

name: Susanna H
text: As a medical professional, I'm not going to go see a doctor unless I absolutely have to. I went to this urgent care on a weekend when I couldn't go see my regular doctor. Dr. Orso, who saw me, did just that--looked at me, shouted out a diagnosis and sent me on my way. He was rude and rushed (spent less than 60 seconds in the room), didn't even touch me, and became angry with me when I asked about whether I could go to work or not. He also completely dismissed the primary reason I had come in, and told me treatment for my primary complaint was "excessive." It would have been nice just to be listened to and felt like he gave a flying flip about his patient.

name: vandalyn green
text: I give this a -5 for service! I went to MedHelp Lakeshore on 2/11/16 at 8 am. I had a temp and chest pain. The wack doctor gave me a shot for sinus and a list of vitamins to take. I told him 3 times how bad my chest was hurting! On 2/14/16 I went to AFC. I had the flu and pneumonia! A lot of fluid in my lungs.

name: Grace
text: Don't waste your time. I have been here once and I don't know what happened in a year but apparently a lot. Waited an hour for the staff to find my insurance and talk to me about my co pay. I was told because I was an emergency visit and they werent my Pcp it would cost more which is garbage. They were unwilling to work with me on figuring out the issue and so I left. Not worth the time.

name: Bobby Wallace
text: Great Physicians and a great place for walk-in medical care

name: Pamela Flanagan
text: I see Dr. Southworth , he has been a very good caring Dr.

name: Cynthia Stewart
text: On the rare occasion I need to go, I see Dr Pink (sorry, just love saying my dude dr. has a color name :) ). While his staff are probably the most non-congenial group of folks, he seems nice enough. He actually takes time to have a conversation and explain things well. My husband saw the black female dr. (sorry, didn't catch her name) and she was friendly as well. As far as Dr. Orso, he was my OB when I lost my first child in 1990. He delivered my first-born and 23 years later, he remembered me when I walked through the office. He hugged me and asked how the kids were. So while the staff have no personalities, the doctors seem knowledgeable and I have definitely had worse experiences.

name: Jana Lee
text: Friendly, prompt service from a knowledgeable staff! Will definitely be back!

name: Michael Hoadley
text: Hello: I had an extremely unfortunate experience today at the Med Help, Inc. Lakeshore (Birmingham, AL) location. After arriving just on time for my 11am follow-up appointment with Dr. Richard Crittendon, and paying my $30.00 co-pay up-front, I took a seat in their waiting room. After about five minutes, I was escorted to the back patient area by a nurse who proceeded to weigh me, then take my blood pressure and my temperature. She then took me next door to an exam room to await Dr. Crittendon. "He'll be with you in a few minutes," she said. I sat in that exam room for the next 55 minutes, listening to the nurses' and Dr. Crittendon's voices passing outside the door. AT NO TIME did anyone "check in" with me or acknowledge the doctor's tardiness. At 12:05pm, I left the room and attempted to speak with one of the four nurses at their station just outside; however, each one was seated and on the telephone. Eventually, I just explained to the receptionist that I could wait no longer (another appointment was pending), and left the building. Now, I understand that physicians are often over-booked or encounter unexpected issues with their patients, however, I do believe that a modicum of professional attention could have been paid during my almost one-hour wait. But, of course, they did have time to process my debit card for the co-pay. I'm afraid my second visit to Med Help on Lakeshore will be my last.

name: Ricky Whitley
text: Love this place!  Quick and professional!

name: Jim Cowley
text: Very Impressed by the Medical Care provided. Will use them again for both my urgent care needs as well as primary care.

name: Elena Neumann
text:
Wow! Not what I was expecting for what I thought was a general "walk-in clinic." I called & made an appointment to meet with Dr. Pink Fulmer.

This place exceeded my expectations. As it took a few minutes for the front clerk to check me in; it didn't take long (maybe 10-15 mins) before I was being called back. (I am a new patient). The lobby to this office is modern, has plenty of seating, and has a neat "charging station" for smart phone users who are running on their last fumes. :) I got called back and the young lady who took my blood pressure/weight was really nice. We talked briefly of the symptoms and she got me back into my private waiting room.

It wasn't long before Dr. Pink was in my room talking to me and asking me about my symptoms and conditions. He has a very calming and relaxing personality which puts a nervous person like me to ease. He truly seemed to care about my concerns and listened to all of my worries about my "condition." He gave me a thorough examination, and even had some tests/xrays done that made me feel a lot better about what I "thought" was happening to my body.

He thoroughly went over my results and overall I was really pleased with he and all of his medical assisting staff. They were all really nice as I was super nervous about even being there. (I rarely go to the doctor). I also ended up getting a flu shot while I was there, and the girl who did it (med assistant) was sweet and did the deed quick and painless.

I was sad to learn that Dr. P. Fulmer will be retiring sometime this year; but I really liked this office and will give their other doctors a shot. Fast and convenient!

I also visited their in-house pharmacy (Rx Pharmacy) and I was thoroughly pleased. They were extremely quick and you can't get any better than picking up your prescriptions up at the same time you saw your doctor. It was cheap and the Pharmacy Owner (can't remember his name) was so down to earth and really pleasant to deal with.

Overall, really pleased with this medical experience and glad to know I have this great place so close to where I live!! :) My husband and I will be using them as our PCP.

**Side note** They also do walk-in's!! So if you are considering this as a walk-in option; try it. It's just as good (in my opinion better!!) than your typical "American Family Care!"

Thanks MEDHELP LAKESHORE!

name: Patrick O'Donnell
text: I have been seeing Dr. Pink Folmar since I was transferred to Birmingham in May of 2013.  The level of care this physician provides is the highest I have received in my 46 years.  His bedside manner is that of an "old world doctor" who would make housecalls if the need arose.  He genuinely cares about his patients.  As a modern physican, Dr. Folmar uses all current diagnostic tools and an incredible wealth of information to provide accurate, efficient health care solutions.  When you leave the office expect to have a detailed printout of your individual care and instructions for patient compliance.   January 6th, 2013 Dr. Folmar saved my life by finding a spontaneous pnuemothorax (collapsed lung) and directing my induction to Brookwood Medical Center.  I am grateful for Dr. Folmar.

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Dr. Hickman is the best!

name: Sarah Inman
text: Dr. Felgner is one of those old school doctors that will sit and listen to you.  The office staff is friendly.

name: stam ahat
text: This place has the worst customer service I have ever seen. Zero in crowd management. This is a business after all, and they don't appreciate you.

name: Linda Wolfe
text: Excellent care at Med Help

name: Jarek Murdock
text: Terrible service, it's been this way for years! My mother had a SCHEDULED appointment and waited on the doctor for TWO hours just to be told that he couldn't see her. I contacted the COO and the supervisor only to be given a mediocre response. Never going back.

name: Emmalee Tidwell
text: The staff ignored me as I entered in and no one was at the desk when I came and signed in. They finally noticed me after a half hour and asked who I was. It was very frustrating and the staff was in no way punctual. I do not plan on returning.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Best doctors & service

name: jd
text: Good doctors!

name: Mintrel Stewart
text: No sir go elsewhere

name: Kenny Sample
text:
(Translated by Google) Very rude front hand.

(Original)
Very rude front dest.

name: Adira Dixie
text: Friendly, fast and gentle!  No one likes a Covid test but these guys are the best I have experienced.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Adira!

name: Jennifer Brand
text: Everyone there is exceptionally wonderful!!! Dr. Vaughn (dad and son) have provided top notch quality care for myself and family since I was 19 (47 now). We are so appreciative of the staff and Dr. Vaughn especially! We drive from PCB, FL just to see him every three months.

resp.text: Thanks Jennifer!

name: Beth Cline
text: The doctors here are wonderful. Especially Dr Mcfaden.  He is the best doctor I've ever had the privilege of seeing.  The whole staff is wonderful.  They are prompt to help with your every medical emergency needs no matter how big or small the situation.  They are my number 1 go to facility with all of my medical needs. I couldn't imagine using anyone else. If you want true medical treatment and you want to be seen fast, this is the place to go.  Thanks MedHelp. You guys are absolutely amazing!

resp.text: Thanks, Beth!

name: Jania Walker-Anderson
text: NEVER use this facility for your medical needs. Jeffrey Young, DO didn’t even do a physical examination when it was necessary. My symptoms persisted even after completing the medication he prescribed me. I had to go somewhere else to get the proper care that I needed. And now seven months later, I’m still being sent bogus bills for services not rendered. Save your time and money. Jeffrey Young, DO is definitely not my doctor of choice.

name: Allyson Varley
text: I love MedHelp! I’ve been getting my primary care here for over a decade. Dr. Russell is an excellent doctor and provides the highest quality of care. Anytime I need anything I am able to send Regina a message via the patient portal and my request is responded to at lightning speed. As I’ve gotten older, my healthcare needs have changed and they continue to evolve their approach to suit my needs. I am so grateful for both Dr. Russell and Regina’s willingness to go above and beyond for their patients.

resp.text: Thank you, Allyson!

name: Layne Viot
text: Left with an astronomical bill after scheduling what essentially should have been a FREE COVID-19 curbside test. Instead they decided to try other tests without me giving consent or the technician making me aware they were doing more than what I had scheduled the appointment for. Now I'm left with the bill. Never had this problem getting tested for COVID at MedHelp in The Narrows.

name: Jason Almon
text:
I had some problems getting all my prescriptions transferred from my pharmacy in Cahaba Heights to Walgreens at Ross Bridge in Hoover. After several attempts of getting some
help, an Employee named Taylor took the Time to get all of my business straight. She was very professional, respectful as well as courteous and Knowledgeable. It’s people like Taylor that make things run smoothly in any organization,  business or Medical facility.  Also,  Dr. Jordan Vaughn, his Nurse and Staff are another example of exemplary attention to detail, as well as true respect and care for their patients. Just as their motto says, they follow the Golden rule!
And that is very much appreciated!

name: Mark Asperger
text: A spreadneck, covidiot anti-masker owns this place.

name: TIARA CALHOUN
text: Mrs Pam is alway great when we come over to our appointments. She is the first person that has drawn blood from me an my mom an we have not complaints. Dr. Perry is our doctor and he always does an amazing job. Shout out to the whole 280 office, I wouldn’t trade y’all for the world.

resp.text: Thanks, Tiara!

name: edward lyons
text:
I'm astounded by how bad the service is at Medhelp. I just received a letter in the mail saying they wont provide any medical care to me anymore. DESPITE being on medications I've taken for years, they wont even give any refills or refer me to another doctor. All because i got upset over the phone. Unbelievable. Disgraceful. Not even sure if it's even lawful. I found another doctor in time for refills hopefully i can actually receive good medical care. Thank god now i wont be having withdrawals because of the incompetence of Medhelp. Malpractice at best. Proves anyone can get a degree or go to medical school for 8 years and be bad at your job.

Response to Owner: Thanks for absolutely nothing. You have done nothing but cause me more physical pain and stress since you cut me off. You do the exact opposite of what you set out for. You call yourself Christians, clearly a lie you don't know ANYTHING about the lord.

resp.text: Mr. Lyons, we are glad to hear that you have found a new doctor and hope that you get the help that you need.

name: Mohammad Firouz
text: If you expect to be treated nicely avoid this branch. The staff were not polite to me at the front desk. Instead use the other branch at Lakeshore with way better service

name: Sydne Rawls
text: I couldn’t be fit in for what I needed help with, but the front desk lady took it upon herself to find me information for someone who could! What a genuine and caring person. She really helped me and I will definitely use their service in the future because of it!

resp.text: Thanks, Sydne!

name: Andrea Wilbanks
text:
I recommend Medhelp to people all the time! I've had Dr. Perry for orthopedics and Dr. Mcfaden for primary and I have to say that I really liked them both, they are very nice and good doctors.  My husband goes to Dr.  Vaughn, has been for years and he wouldn't dare ever change doctors. The rest of the staff has always been friendly BUT I really must brag about nurse Pam! She is just so sweet and such a wonderful nurse. I've had so many blood tests and IVs at Brookwood over the last few weeks leaving my arms bruised
and veins blown. Every single nurse that I have encountered recently has had a hard and in some cases impossible time trying to stick me. Not Mrs. Pam! She just went right in like a breath of fresh air NOT having to dig around inside my arm with a needle! Thank you for making my most recent experience so easy.

resp.text: Thanks, Andrea!

name: Brenda Gonzalez
text: Everyone at the facility is soooo nice. A huge thank you to ALL the staff. I had given up on doctors roughly 3 years ago but they definitely gave me a new perspective on medical care. So thank you

resp.text: Thanks, Brenda!

name: L B
text: I just want to say how proficient and caring Eugene was in giving me a Covid and flu test swab. The procedure was very quick and painless, and delivered with a smile and caring nature. I was very pleased with this MedHelp facility.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Destin Booker
text: I have to brag about Pam…I’m generally a really hard stick and she got it on the first try. Also very sweet.

resp.text: Thanks, Destin!

name: Susan Latham
text: Due to cough and chest congestion, called to get covid test. Talked with Dr Willoughby via a short virtual visit.   She ordered covid test and, as an aside, said she would also run a lung test.   I should have said no to the additional testing.   Covid test was covered 100% with no deductible by my insurance.   The additional test was originally $653 which included an additional office visit, adjusted by insurance agreement to $322.33 all of which I owed since I had not yet met my deductible for the year.   Not pleased.

resp.text: Susan, we hate to hear that you haven't yet met your deductible, however, we are glad that you received the same excellent care that we provide for all of our patients. Thank you for choosing MedHelp.

name: Wendy Love
text: I needed a rapid Covid test, and Med Help went above and beyond to make sure I got it. Eugene was fantastic! I can’t say enough about his professionalism and caring attitude to make sure I got everything I needed. This is a group of outstanding individuals working through what is arguably a dangerous time for front line healthcare workers, and yet they still smile and treat you with kindness. I Highly recommend Med Help 280 because they are such compassionate and professionals.

resp.text: Thanks, Wendy!

name: Elizabeth Robinson
text: Litisa was amazing....:I did not feel good at all and she made the intake process a breeze...I will be recommending to all my family and friends....

name: April Showers
text:
We began going to Dr. Vaughn Senior at MedHelp on Lakeshore. We adored him. He was the most awesome doctor. However. Since he retired, the quality of care has steadily decreased to the point where at my husband's last visit for a wound that spontaneously opened on his lower leg, Dr. Willoughby would not even touch him to look at it and simply threw him a prescription for antibiotics and a dressing for him to apply HIMSELF, and told him to come back in ten days if it wasn't better.
