text: I came in Saturday so sick and while Nurse Ebone was collecting a nasal swab I became extremely nauseated and told her I was about to throw up. She immediately helped me into the lobby and set me down and brought out a bag that I ended up filling up and another 1/2 one. She also placed cold wet towels on my neck and head which brought some relief because I was clammy and burning up. She then wheeled me into a room and laid me down and turned the lights off because I had a splitting headache, and brought me a bottle of cold water. The care, compassion, and genuine concern she gave me was extremely comforting in my vulnerable and painful state. She treated me with dignity, respect, and gentleness. I can tell this is not just a job to her but a true calling and I am so thankful for her.

name: Rachel Rhodes
text: had to visit for a quick COVID test before being around family for thanksgiving... the process was quick however the nurse was the rudest person i have ever came in contact with. unfortunately i don't remember her name. I had to have my test in the lobby and she had an attitude about any questions I asked. VERY RUDE!! being in health care myself, it really would help if you got staff that cared about their jobs. You are taking care of sick people and the last thing they need is to feel like a bother to the person supposed to be there to help them.

name: Melicia Owens
text: Dont come here for covid19 testing  I was swabbed at 8:15.Sat in my car for three hours,had to ask about my results for them to find them.Staff need to be trained no one knows what they are doing..Needs new managment and staff..This is ridiculous

name: Susan Hutto
text: The triage nurse was like a army sergeant. The Dr. Was also very rude. Very bad experience, will not go back. People who came there to be tested for Covid were allowed to come and go freely through the waiting area.

name: Robert Sachar
text: Go somewhere else...

name: Kaitlyn P
text: Wish I could give this place 0 stars. I’ve ALWAYS gone to Wetumpka Urgent Care. Today I went and paid my $75 copay. The front desk staff waited until after I paid to let me know I had a $900 account balance which it total BS. I was never notified. I have always had insurance and paid my copays. Any bill that comes to my mailbox gets paid right away. I don’t play when it comes to my credit. Never again will I go there. I absolutely loved how they told me this after I paid $75 then asked me for more money due to this “balance” I will now go to primed! Disputing this BS as well. Staff has changed to snobs and ignorance. Don’t waste your time people. Go to primed

name: Katelyn Lambeth
text: They literally NEVER answer the phone. Extremely unprofessional of a business...

name: Mandi Carmichael
text:
I brought my daughter in this morning and was blown away by how wonderful all of the staff were.
We were placed in a room quickly and even had two separate staff members come in to check on us to see if there was anything we needed while we waited for Nurse Practitioner Singer to see us.
NP Singer was amazing, extremely nice and really listened to the issues.
Very impressive and very professional group of people..A+ in my book.

name: George & Aimee White
text: The doctors and staff are very good and friendly.  Ivy Creek on the other had will inflate your bill.  Make sure you get a print out of the services provided and compare them against your EOB.  I did this and found additional lab charges that were not performed along with discovering that they sent some samples to the Elmore Community Hospital to run similar tests that way they can charge an additional "facility co-pay" for using their lab on top of the lab at the urgent care facility.

name: basspro159
text: The front desk person was so rude. I decided to leave and go to the primed down the street. Avoid these places if you can.

name: Jeania Mathews
text: I was treated very friendly here, however, the lab machine was down that day so I was told they would call me with the results. And they would set me up with a primary care provider. 2 weeks go by I call to ask for my lab results and ask about the primary care physician. I am told someone would call me back with my results and that they don't refer to primary care physicians but that I could call River region to get a doctor. Still have not heard back from my labs. I don't know anyone that likes to go to the doctor let alone an office that can't return phone calls or give lab results in a timely manner. Very poor management in my opinion.

name: Whitney Jones
text: Just had the worst experience I have ever had I will never go to this establishment again. I wouldn't even rate this business a 1 but you had to leave a start to give a review! Ebony, demillya and calea are far from professional! One laughed, one tried I give her that and the other one could give 2 cents cant help but wonder if it was because i walked in at 615 and they close at 7

name: Lysee Spigener
text: People are very rude... I went to urgent care because I was sick to my stomach, acing everywhere and couldn't hardly think straight they said it "sounded like the flu" And gave me all this medicine after a whole week I was still sick sick so I went to my primary doctor and turns out I had walking pneumonia and the medicine they gave me was not effective with the pneumonia I had had so I was taking unnecessary drugs.. Oh and yeah I was miserable a whole freaking week and a half...

name: Aimee Clements
text: The staff was great. Very friendly and easy to talk to. The Dr I had was also very nice and very understanding to my needs and pain level. (I have double ear infections pretty bad.) I was so out of it though, I didn't pay attention to her name. Overall a great experience.

name: Nic Lloyd
text: The x-ray techs (Kristal, Alex, and Nic) were by far the nicest, most professional, and of course the most efficient employees of the Wetumpka urgent care staff. Yes all of the other nurses were great, but not once did I notice the x-ray crew NOT doing there jobs!!!! Urgent Care has the best X-Ray techs around town! Dr. Aldrich and Dr. Floyd are very knowledgeable and courteous. I recommend this establishment to anyone and everyone from symptoms perusing the flu or if its just for a common cold. Urgent Care if the staff to see!!!!

name: Nic Ole
text: Been waiting here almost 3 hours now and they aren’t even busy. Front desk worker is not friendly. Just need some antibiotics and to be sent on my way. I won’t return.

name: Candace Moore
text: This place is horrible . I just left there highly disappointed!! Some of the staff was very unfriendly especially the one that sits up front at the window. The one that took my vitals was totally uninterested in what she was doing. At the end of my visit I was basically told there was nothing they could do. They ended up supposedly writing me a prescription.  I take the prescription to Wal -Greens only to find out the prescription was for someone else. So I'm still in pain and I have someone else's prescription . I don't know where these people came from but I would advise you to go somewhere else!!

name: mallory chandler
text: Dirty inside in waiting area. Front desk not trained well. Saw me signing in my 2 year old son. Stated to them I was signing in my son. I filled out all of the paperwork and was told,”oh we don’t see 2 year olds.”

name: keesha Osborne
text: My mom have been going there for almost 4 yrs.and Dr.Aldrich save her life with his knowledge she swears by him very courteous and and patient thank you so much my mom seems happier than she has in years

name: lilhayme
text: The best urgent care in the area. Knowledgable and friendly staff. The doctors have the best beside manner, and check everything to make sure they are giving you the best diagnosis. When my family and I have urgent care needs, this is now the only place in the area where we will go

name: Dixie Forever
text: They have only one doctor on duty.  I had chest congestion and a cough.  All I wanted was a prescription for an antibiotic.  The waiting room was jammed up.  I spent about 4 hours waiting to be seen.  The doctor, Dr. Barrow, was very nice, but she wanted to get me a chest x-ray and breathing  treatment.  It was now after 7PM.  I needed to get to the Walmart pharmacy before they closed so I could get my prescriptions filled.  I declined the x-ray and breathing treatment because of the late hour. They need more than one doctor on duty..

name: C M
text: Some of the staff was friendly, I sat there an hour before the staff awknowledged me and remembered to give me paper work to fill out. They also sent me two bills, one was for lab tests that they didnt tell me they were doing and didnt even bother letting me know the results.

name: Mary Ball
text:
I always get good service. Staff always friendly
During FLU season the wait is always longer

name: Emily Briggs
text: If I could give them zero stars, I would. I showed up to this urgent care to get refills on my medications, because I had moved to Wetumpka a couple days prior. They were not prompt in acknowledging my arrival into the waiting room, but eventually, one of the two ladies stopped gabbing and asked if they could helped me. I explained that I needed medication refills, and they asked what medications I was on in front of all the other patients in the waiting room. I am not shy about the medications I'm on, but some people are, and they should be sensitive to that. I told them, and they informed me that they don't have primary care physicians, and that they generally don't write prescriptions except for things such as sports injuries or general illnesses that pop up in daily life. I understand that, and said that was fine, I could find somewhere else to go, but they seemed upset at that prospect, and said they would ask the doctor on call if he would make an exception and asked me to fill out paperwork while they asked him. I did, and the doctor said he would make an exception, so I waited and filled out the paperwork to be seen. I waited a good while in the exam room, and when the doctor finally came in, he ho-hummed about giving the medicine that he supposedly had told the office staff he would give me with no problem. He finally asked me if I had enough to patch me over, and I informed him that I did not, so he wrote me the prescription (with refills, so he must not have had too much of a problem prescribing it), and sent me on my way. I left on my merry way, said good-bye to the office staff on my way out, and headed to the pharmacy to fill my prescriptions. Upon handing over the prescription, however, it was discovered that the doctor had given me an *unsigned* prescription! I'm fairly certain that could have ended very badly for him, had I chosen to make it, but since I needed those medications, I grumpily brought the prescription back to the now-busy urgent care, waited about fifteen minutes for the office staff to again acknowledge my existence at their window, and then get them to have the doctor sign his own prescription, that he had issued and sent into the world to have done who knows what with without his signature, begging to have fraudulence done in his name. So he signed it, and I filled the prescription, but the nonsense did not end there. Beyond all of that, I got a voicemail, without my phone ever ringing, which I'm sure was not their fault, but the fault of my phone, but the voicemail said something to the effect that they had made me an appointment that I had not asked for that I would be charged for if I did not show up for at an arbitrary date and time, and to call or come by if this was an inconvenience, and leaving no phone number to call back. I then got a letter in the mail, stating the date and time of this arbitrary appointment I had not asked them to make for me, which I was to be charged for if I no-showed on, that had a number to call if I wanted to cancel the appointment. I called the number, and it brought me to a busy signal, which hung up on me after five seconds each time I called (I tried this three times before coming on Google to look up their actual number to call and ream them out). Supposedly, they have cancelled this bogus appointment that they made for me. My question is: why do they make appointments at all, if they do not do primary care, and are supposedly only available for sports injuries and normal day to day illnesses? Do people nowadays schedule their injuries and illnesses? Why on earth would they schedule me an appointment in the first place, let alone without my asking for them to do so? Avoid this establishment at all costs. If you are looking for a place to receive urgent care or primary care, try PriMed that's right next to Walmart, right up the road. They actually respect their customers, do not make you appointments you never asked for, sign their prescription pads, do not ho-hum about writing you life-saving prescriptions, and treat you like a human being.

name: Sabrina London
text: Just called Wetumpka Urgent Care to ask a few questions about insurance acceptance. They intake nurse was rude, and cut me off several time. Each question was answered with Uhhuh instead of Yes. I believe her name was Jeniva. My elderly mother is ill, and at this time a bit of understanding would have been nice.

name: Camaron Kelley
text: In and out not alot of time spent with patient. Sign in room says limit complaints to 2 come back if you have more.... Really??

name: ashley kilano
text: The only thing good about this place is that it's cheap. The staff is always rude and they could care less about you. They sound like they play around more than take their job serious and one of the girls at the front desk was laughing at someone on the phone. Terrible customer service. Not friendly at all. I don't have any medical experience and I could probably do their job better. Every time I go I feel really uncomfortable and the doctor never seems sure about what he's saying. It makes me sad.

name: Bridget Cheathem
text: The Dr. I had literally looked everything up online. I saw him do it... any question I had he went to his laptop. He didn't wait for test results. When I tried calling back to get my results I was told I would get a call back, that call NEVER came! Also, It seemed like he didn't listen to a word I told him. I will not be going back or reffer this place to a friend. The AFC  next to Walmart is ALOT better!!

name: J Day
text:
Nephew came with flu like symptoms, ran blood work given IV and was told he had stomach virus.  Went to Baptist East next morning and he tested positive for viral meningitis and put in hospital.
This was there second chance because several months he went and told it was a stomach virus and the next night had to go to Baptist South ER only to find out it was kidney stones.  Don't thing we will try a third time.

name: Kris Johnson Kephart
text: Professional & Sweet! ___ PROS-Super sweet & smiling staff! (Cathy, Nicole, Karman) * Very clean waiting room, powder room & facility * Personal TV in the back patient rooms! * Great Doctor (Dr. Cobb) Thorough & super nice___ CONS-Possible 1 hour wait time on 1st visit * Little Reading material-No Magazines & very few brochures (bring something to do) ___ SUMMARY: I went there as I am changing doctors and my 1st appointment is a month away. I was a bit nervous, not knowing anyone, and in pain. I was taken care of and left feeling better all ready:) Feel free to go to this Care facility if you need medical help!!___ * KRIS JOHNSON KEPHART * TALLASSEE, AL

name: Michael Mann
text: Unfortunately, when you need assistance after your visit, such as cough syrup for the flu, they don't have time to order a prescription. Was told their priority is patients in the waiting room above anyone already under their care. This is corporate policy. Not sure, maybe this has to do with who's money they already have vs who's they don't have yet!

name: Shannon Geer
text: Longest wait times

name: Jennifer Berry
text: Signing in on line was nice. The front desk staff was so friendly to everyone that walked up. The nurse who triaged me was very kind. The NP that took care of me was knowledgeable, answered questions, and made the experience less stressful. Very satisfied.

name: Caitlin Seahorn
text: We came in at 7:30, right before closing, and we were the only patients there. The staff did not show any sign of any frustration. They were quick to assist me and allowed my husband to do what he could for me. The NP kept me talking to get my mind off my migraine and without realizing, it actually helped. She recommended a pharmacy right down the road since it was after hours and would be easier to get than the pharmacy I listed. Both ladies were super friendly; I’ve never had such a great interaction when I was in such pain.

name: Kei Bottoms
text: It's nice to be able to hold your spot from your phone, and enter all of the necessary information before heading out. You still have to wait some from time to time, but nothing compared to just walking in. Front lady is always very nice, she listens to you well and gives you what you need. I can tell how busy she can be, yet she is very very patient and polite. Entire staff is very nice group of ladies. Highly recommended.

name: Carolyn Holt
text: I am a veteran and the Muscle Shoals location is approved for urgent care needs of veterans when we can't get into our outpatient clinic fast. Upon arrival, I gave the receptionist the info she needed to make sure I am approved for care thru the VA. This poor lady was on the phone for close to 45 min trying to get the information she needed on a reference number. She was transfered to other numbers, only to be disconnected. She was literally my guardian angel towards the VA to get me seen. At one point, I even offered to pay the costs and "argue" with the VA on my own. She refused to let me pay out of pocket expenses for my visit because I was a veteran. I was so touched by her help and determination. Unfotunately, I don't know her name, but because of her kindness, I will always give this clinic high reviews to anyone who listens. To that receptionist: YOU ROCK and THANK YOU!!!

name: Melissa Scofield
text: They do a great job!  Very nice staff and they know what they’re doing. Highly recommend.

name: Taylor Boston
text: I have visited this facility a couple different times, and overall have had a good experience every time. I went yesterday and saw the NP, who is always great. I left very pleased, and even got on and left a good review. Today, I retract that good review. I understand they are busy, and it’s a crazy time. Yet, things were told to me by the front desk on the phone on one call, and then I was told “I am putting words in her mouth” and had a nice little argument on a separate call. I will not put the whole situation on here, unnecessary, but I just am not pleased with what happened. I work in healthcare, and usually do not complain about bad experiences, because everyone has bad days. Just felt like something needed to be said.

resp.text: Taylor, we regret you had a negative experience while in our care, especially after several good ones. We strive to ensure every patient receives an exceptional experience, every time. We appreciate your feedback as we would like to address your concerns and improve where we can. Please contact us directly at info@hhurgentcare.org to discuss your experience further.

name: Sandra B
text: Very friendly staff! My in and out time was amazing.... shortest visit I\'ve ever had while getting excellent care. Would highly recommend

name: Michael Charpentier
text: Fast and efficient. No hassle health-care. An oasis in the maze of finding quality care. Thank you Courtney 😊

name: John kyler
text: Here I was delivering to a local business. Started rushing around to get things done because it was Friday evening and I didn't want anyone to stay longer than needed. Welp it ended up that I got a nasty injury on a finger. The crew at Huntsville got me right in and had me fixed up good. The staff was very professional, caring and friendly. Whether it's a dust storm or a virus. They got it covered!

resp.text:
John,
We are sorry you hurt yourself but glad we were able to get you taken care of. Thanks for choosing us and thanks for the great review!

name: Kendal Crowell
text: I have always hated going to the doctor, however, the office staff and the practitioner, Courtney, made me feel so comfortable and welcome. They took good care of me and made COVID-19 testing not bad at all. I will definitely be coming back here when I need healthcare in the future.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback and 5-star review! We appreciate it.

name: Baron C
text: Extremely friendly, professional and courteous staff. The entire staff was very knowledgeable and made my visit quick and easy.

resp.text: Thank you for the review.

name: Bill Beard
text: Very poor service.  I pre-set an oppointment for 9:45, I arrived early and waited for over 3 hours to see a nurse.  I will never come here again.

resp.text:
Bill,
We are sorry you did not have a good experience due to the extensive wait at our center. We appreciate feedback and use it to improve where we can. Please contact us directly at: info@hhurgentcare.org and someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Rachel Walls
text: From the super friendly office staff to the amazing Nurse practitioner I had a wonderful experience.  I love the way they are constantly spraying Lysol to help with the spread of germs!!  Nurse Practitioner, Erica Hogeland was awesome. She is easy to talk to and very knowledgeable of my condition. I will defiantly recommend them to my family and friends!

resp.text: Thanks for this great review and recommendation. We are here to help!

name: JulieAnnShultz
text: The staff was so sweet with our 2 year old today. It was 15 minutes until closing and we came in with a broken arm. They took their time and gave her the best care! 100% recommend this clinic!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Tracy
text: The NP and other staff provided quick and competent care . I will definitely return for any urgent care needs

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Ella Cannon
text: The ladies who took care of me were super nice and professional. If you ever need blood work done go here and ask for Haley. I have always feared getting my blood drawn but I barley felt it at all!!! Thanks ladies for being so awesome.

name: Laurie Lane
text: This place is great! I cannot stand going to the doctor. The staff here is super friendly and helpful. The facilities are clean and modern. Highly recommend!

resp.text: We appreciate your business and thank you for leaving a 5-star review. Come back and see us when you need to.

name: Chad Thompson
text: Absolutely Amazing Experience! Super Friendly Receptionist, The Nurse Practitioner Was Excellent! Made us feel cared about, and like a family oriented atmosphere! Highly Recommended!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your recommendation and great review!

name: Katie Holt
text: Unfortunately we have had to visit this urgent care several times since Christmas because of sickness, but I wouldn't dare go anywhere else in the Shoals when we need a quick visit. Everyone I have met on their staff is very friendly and helpful.  Ms. Pennington, CRNP is my favorite to see. She is very nice and seems to be genuinely concerned about our health.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We are glad we've been able to help.

name: Morgan McCullar
text:
The best advice I can give is DO NOT go here. I went in this morning because I had a sore throat and runny nose. I simply wanted to be tested for flu or strep before I returned to work. They did not take my temperature or anything, but asked me if I had been to China. When I responded that I had recently been to Europe (not China), the doctor came out and said, “I will not see you. You need to leave”.
She made me feel like a freak and she did not treat me like a fellow human being. I asked, “you won’t even test me for flu?”  And she said, “no, you need to go to the ER. This is serious.”
I went to another doctor’s office and it turns out I have a sinus infection. These people should be ashamed of the way they treat patients. I went there for help and I was turned away very rudely.

resp.text:
Morgan,
We apologize for your experience at our center. There is a protocol for international travel and we do not turn away patients that need care. This situation is being addressed and handled by management. If you would like to discuss further, you may contact us at: info@urgentteam.com.

name: Dee Rachela Houston
text: Always wonderful from the moment you walk in until you leave. Truly a wonderful staff! Even my kids love to come because they have a kid friendly table and crayons w printouts. Above and beyond and the medical team here is superb!

name: Captain Krunch
text: Took my insurance card, charged me a 10 dollar co pay. 3 weeks down the road I received a bill for the full amount. I seen a similar review of this here and had I known this was going to happen then i just would have left. Seems pretty shady to me.

resp.text:
Sorry for the delayed response. Our centers offer a safe credit card payment option called Secure Pay. The front desk should have made you aware of this as it provides a convenient and secure method for you to pay your insurance deductible and coinsurance prior to service. Additionally, your credit card will be used to pay any remaining balances your insurance does not cover.

After your visit, we submit your medical claim to your insurance company for the services provided. Once your insurance company pays its contracted portion, you will receive a statement in the mail explaining the portion your insurance paid and what (if any) balance is your responsibility. You will then have 14 days from the statement date to either arrange for another method of payment or request more information regarding the bill. If we have not received payment after 14 days, Secure Pay will charge your credit card for the balance due.

If you would like to discuss further, please email your contact information to: info@urgentteam.com and someone will reach out shortly.

name: Em
text: Wait time was minimal but I was misdiagnosed. I was told sinus infection but I actually have shingles that spread to my eye.  I was very clear with my complaints/symptoms, but was still misdiagnosed. (I didn't know it at the time, but all the symptoms I had basically screamed shingles infection.)  You'd think if I'm capable of googling this, a nurse practitioner would have certainly recognized the symptoms and learned about it in school. 🤷🏻‍♀️  She was actually kind of rude, didn't listen to me (obviously) and seemed more concerned with the little brown flecks I have in my irises. Seriously?! I was given antibiotics but should have gotten an antiviral medicine. Timing is crucial with this, and since I didn’t start the medicine in a timely manner, it’s going to take twice as long to heal, and I could lose vision in my eye. This place is probably okay for kids ear infections, bronchitis, etc., but that’s it. I won’t be going back.

name: Destinee Barnes
text: This facility refused to see a patient that had a fever of 101.3 and is 6 weeks pregnant. Told I would have to come back the next morning at 8am. It was 4:30 and they didn’t close until 5.

resp.text: We are sorry we were unable to help you at our center recently. While we take walk-ins, we also encourage the use of our online scheduling to avoid long waits. Unfortunately, due to unprecedented volumes, some centers may reach maximum capacity before the end of posted hours. When this occurs, it is necessary for the center to stop additional registration/check-ins for the remainder of the day. We are making ongoing refinements to meet the community's need for services during the pandemic and keep everyone safe, and apologize if this happened when you needed to see one of our healthcare providers.

name: Lisa Green
text: Had to carry my son in on friday August 17,2019. He had been stung on his face by an unknown bee/wasp. His face had began to swell as well as his eyes swelling shut. I knew we didn't have much time. He was seen immediately and treated with the best care possible. Everyone there was amazing and very professional. Big shout out to the entire staff and a special thank u for calling to check on Alex today. ❤❤❤

name: Brittney Shupe
text: I have been here several times. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The wait time has never been very long

resp.text: Thanks Brittney

name: Aaron Page
text: Front Clerk was excellent as well as all other support staff. Quick, Efficient, Friendly!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Mercedes Alexander
text: The CRNP and the black nurse where amazing they both were sweet and understanding . My issue is with the receptionist she has ZERO personality and was kind of rude. I would go back because I received good care but I think they should hire more personable office assistants.

name: Breanna Prestage
text: Super fast visit in and out ! Everyone was super friendly and very caring.  I would highly reccomend urgent team in muscle shoals !

name: Archantia Whiteside
text: The Receptionist Is Rude , Didn’t Smile Not Once At Anyone Who Came In Interrupts You ,  While Thinking She Knows Everything Do Better Please Ma’am But Other Than That Great Place And The Nurse Was Sweet And Caring .

name: jaidah riboldi
text: This place is amazing they are totally kid friendly and they have really nice service and will take care of your every need

resp.text: Thank you! Glad we could help!

name: Hunter Barnett
text: Was in and out in 30 mins. Got me taken care of. Much faster and better than Med Plus.

resp.text: Thank you Hunter

name: Kimberley Powell
text: When your sick, you don’t want to get out in public much less wait anywhere and I was in and out here within 30 minutes. Very friendly staff and super clean place! Highly recommended!

name: Dusty McCain
text: Quick friendly knowledgeable staff! Would definitely recommend going here.

resp.text: Thanks Dusty!

name: Jon Cannon
text: They really care about you and your need. Great Medical Treatment. Thanks!!!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Lee Watkins
text:
Positives - Facility is clean. Very little wait time. Staff is friendly. CRNP Erica is thorough and friendly.

Negatives - CRNP Laura is rude. Interrupts. Doesn’t listen. Also brought teenage child in with flu A and cough. They can’t prescribe anything stronger than over the counter. So don’t waste time or money unless you need them to help you pick out an over the counter med. Go to your medical doctor. So I gave it a 1 star as the visit was unproductive and wish I’d waited 12 hours until our pediatrician opened.

resp.text:
Lee,
We are sorry you had this experience at our center. With the flu, the only prescription given is for anti-virals (Tamiflu, and the brand new Xofluza) IF given within the first 48 hours since symptoms first came on. We are more than happy to discuss your treatment (and your son's) further -- if you'd like to send your contact email/phone number directly to: info@urgentteam.com someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Maria Strickland
text: Came in 10 mins before closing my husband had poison oak and they took him in with no problem. Very friendly people and was in and out quickly.

resp.text:
Maria,
Thanks for your review, we appreciate your feedback. Glad we were able to help.

name: Patrick Oliver
text: Great staff , fast, super friendly and great care everytime !

resp.text: Happy to oblige!

name: Cody Braly
text: Haley, Sherka, and Nataline provided very great, fast, and professional service.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Reyaires Anderson
text: Very friendly staff, clean facilities, always very helpful. Wait time is little to none and the nurses are always caring to each situation you may have.

resp.text:
Reyaires,
Thanks for the 5-star review. We appreciate it. We are glad you had a good experience and hope you rely on us in the future to help take care of you.

name: Gee Connson
text: I used these people once, your best advice is if you are reading this and your name has not been called yet leave and go to some where down the street.

name: Brandon Staggs

resp.text:
Brandon,
Unfortunately there is an after hours fee that is billed (to some insurances) for hours outside of regular office hours. If you wish to discuss further and see your cost breakdown, please contact us directly at: info@urgentteam.com

name: Charlotte Chamberlain
text: Super nice staff..It didn't take long. Fast diagnosis ..Thanks for helping me today.

name: Rhonda Mannon
text: Super friendly and caring staff. Love them here!

name: Jaz N
text: Usually no long wait. Always friendly and helpful. My kids and I have been here multiple times.

name: Dar Spe
text: Everything was fine as I signed in to see the dr. They took my insurance card and charged my copay but a couple weeks down the road I received a bill for the entire amount. I found out later they dont take my insurance. There was no mention to me of this or I would have left. Now I owe over 120$ because of it. I won't go back that's for sure. I have a very well known insurance ot would have paid but now I'm stuck with a bill.

name: Kimberly Osborne
text: I had to wait 40 minutes to see anybody. There was only 2 people in front of me. The nurse told me i tested positive for the flu but are thought it was alloy gone so she didn't give me a prescription for it. Needless to say I'm worse Rossi than yesterday andI feel I waisted my money going here. The receptionist let me stand there for 10 minutes after I see the nurse waiting for a paper to take to my job.

resp.text: Kimberly, We are sorry you’ve had this experience at our center. And sorry you are not feeling well. We would appreciate the opportunity to follow up directly with you. Please email your name and email address and/or phone number to info@urgentteam.com and a center manager will reach out to you shortly to discuss. Thank you.

name: ANTOINE Robinson

name: Kellie Calderon
text: Great service. Modern

name: Stitchedbyyoshi

name: Linda Hudson

name: Jennifer Hughes
text: I had a really great experience here. Ashley at the front desk was so nice and made me feel welcomed as soon as I walked into the office. I love that they are open until 8pm so that I can easily schedule an appointment after work. Dr. "Chili" was great as well. He made me feel like he was really listening to me and I felt like he really put some thought into what medication would be best for me. He thoroughly explained what the medication was and what the possible side effects could be. This was the best experience I have ever had with a doctor before.

The med is incorrect, not the right amount and takes at least a weak to even fix the issue. I'm finding a different one, because this is just nothing but a big inconvenience.

text: Unfortunately I did not have a great experience with my "therapist". Wish I could say better , I was meeting with Pamela Callaghan for therapy, I had missed a scheduled visit and received a NOT SO HAPPY call from Pamela, she stated she wish I would have called the office to cancel instead of missing the virtual appointment I told her I wanted to pay for my previous bill first to which she replied " Are you still working?" I answered yes. She asked if I was still taking medication i replied yes for anxiety and she said " SOUNDS LIKE YOU NEED ANTIDEPRESSANTS" . Its nice to know if your at work and miss a virtual visit with your therapist you will be judged and labeled depressed with no Apology. Would not recommend.

resp.text: I am very sorry to hear about your experience, would you like a call from the manager?

name: Lisa Hallmon
text: I wouldn’t even give one star. My mom was admitted to Shelby Hospital for psychological reasons. She could walk and talk before entering. After being put on extreme medication from Alabama Psychiatry facility, my mother couldn’t talk nor walk. She has been in the hospital now for over a month. She is finally talking and her mind is coming back slowly. She still can not walk. She has been to 3 hospitals where they said my mother was highly over medicated and she has Parkinsonism from way to much antipsychotic medication. Alabama Psychiatry Doctors put her on all them. This has been so hard. I am now dealing with depression and stress as well over all of this. Do not let your loved ones go to this place! They will way over medicate. I also had spoke to the doctor about feeling that my mom was way over medicated and she just Dropped her down one dose but then added an antidepressant.  It’s been a complete change in my moms life. A horrible change!!! Another hospital is trying to get her medication corrected where hopefully she will be able to get back to normal and walk again

name: Bree B
text: Dr. Chowhurdy is an angel. I have been seeing psychiatrist for ten years, and she is the first I’ve felt truly comfortable being open with. She saved my life, and in turn I will now be well wnough to be a wonderful mom

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review

name: Lana Farley
text: I have had a awesome experience with Dr M he's listens n cares I couldn't ask for more

name: Taylor Simmons
text: Dr. Dumas refuses to listen. She would not give me the time of day to explain my daughter's behavior. Therefore, I will no longer be taking my daughter to her.

resp.text: We apologize if we were unable to satisfactorily meet your needs,  I will notify the office manager.

name: Kylee Pickle
text: If it were not for the doctor I see I would certainly go somewhere else!  The front desk “girls” do not know what they are doing nor do they know how to treat people with respect and dignity.  If you have opportunity to actually get them on the phone!!  The “girls” in the billing department are not any better if not worse! They never call back when messages are left and again if you ever get them on the phone! We work just as hard as they do for pay and when insurance is filled wrong and a bill is received saying you owe a certain amount for a visit when the last two years my insurance covers 100%?  I’m going to call and question what the problem is and expect a professional to handle themselves the way they should when they work in a doctor’s office!

resp.text: I will refer this to the office manager.

name: Nicole Kennel
text: The providers are great when you can get in to see them. However, the entire place is useless if you need anything outside the appointment. They don't answer phone calls. Take weeks to respond to messages, and if you need paperwork filled out for any reason, they are super unhelpful. Been with them for years, but this has become there norm. I will be looking for another practice as soon as I can.

resp.text: I'm sorry that you haven't received the care that you expected, if you would like to discuss it please email me at psychalabama@gmail.com

name: Kenneth Larkin
text: Dr. Chowdhury and her staff are the most caring compassionate medical professionals I have EVER had the pleasure of working with. While all the others were concerned about me having insurance and "unable to schedule without" this practice immediately recognized my needs and were able to see me the same day. Dr. Chowdhury took the time to listen carefully and understand what was happening and offered very effective treatment options. If you need this type of care, do NOT hesitate to reach out to these professionals. The exemplify the standards of care. I am thankful for being able to connect with them and certainly have a new "perspective" on my life. Thank you so very much Dr. Chowdhury

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!

name: Lori chapman
text: I have been trying to get my meds  correct for 2 months now. They are not good about sending p.a.s in. I have told them since September I have no more visits left so I can’t schedule a visit until January after speaking to aHolly several times she said I should hear back from her by Tuesday. It is Friday, and when I called the said Holly was busy they were transferring me to the nurse where nothing is done correct I go over again what has been happening she put me on hold and came back and said the dr would come back to talk to me. He did call. And at 2:50 I was send an email saying I confirmed my appointment this morning at 9:20. I never requested an appointment cause I am out of visits and they new that. Now they want money. Well they won’t get it I only receive 221.00  a month they get nothing and they have lost a patient. I would never recommend this office

name: Bama Fan2019
text: The Dr’s are very helpful and nice but your front office staff other than the 1 lady that I believe is new is horrific. The dark hair young lady that checked me in when I got there was just as nice and pleasant as she could be. The heavy set blond lady was VERY rude about my account talking to me in front of everyone about my balance. This is something that should be kept private. When I was leaving and trying to reschedule my next appointment I had to wait because the only person in the office was the nice young lady that checked me in. She had phones ringing and other customers checking in and no help. Finally the second lady came in with a attitude. The owner of this business needs to come in and do some house cleaning in the front office except for the dark hair young lady, she was the only bright spot of your business. Hope I never deal with the rude blond lady I think her name was Valerie or something like that. Very sad service!

name: Chris Johnston
text: Worst place ever. The young lady at the window was very kind however, she is the only bright spot. Other were standing around talking while everyone in the lobby was standing in line. The last 3 times I have been in there your billing has been screwed up saying I owe money. I’ve learned to just bring my credit card statement with me. Service is the worst I have ever seen.

name: Jean-Paul Bootier
text: Great staff and wonderful doctors. Never had a bad experience

name: Rhiannon Perkins
text: This was the most disappointing experience I have ever experienced EVER! I’ve been to some sh*t doctors before but I’ve never had to deal with such idiocracy before in my life. My husband was a patient with them and has had great success so I made an appointment after hearing good reviews from him and also another family member. I made an appointment a week before and two days before they called to tell me that they had to change my doctor due to a “conflict of interest”. Meaning it was my husband’s therapist and they wanted me to see the other therapist available. I agreed and set the appointment for later in the day. The day came for my appointment and I receive a call from the therapist saying that she wouldn’t be able to see me either for the same reason even though my other family member had STOPPED seeing her. She said she would call me back after I told her to go ahead and cancel my appointment. Never received a call. I showed up at the office 30 minutes early and she asked to see me in her office where she tried to further explain the “conflict of interest” that they kept referring to. I told her I could find a place closer to home that wouldn’t turn someone away who was looking for help. If you’re thinking about going here, make sure no one you know is a patient as well. Otherwise, you might become another “conflict of interest” like me and not be told until you show up because even though they say they called you and got your voicemail. I guess actually LEAVING a voicemail is too complex. I’m not doubting their ability to help, but being turned away at the door when you want help feels like an emotional slap to the face.

name: T Farris
text: The initial physician was great but after that downhill.  I was never told that I would have to have numerous appointments in order to get the testing completed. My appointment with the intake physician was changed 3 times and the last time was due to their issue with getting a THEIR new physician set up.  Still not sure how that is the patient's problem. All I was told was I could go elsewhere but the wait was going to be long. Not really because I was able to get into their office.  Unreal canceled everything and WILL NOT RETURN OR RECOMMEND.  If I could leave 0 stars I would.

name: Devin “Gearhog” Payne
text:
I left an extremely emotional, long, desperate email on my appointment request, and got a call back only a couple days later. The woman I spoke to was kind and genuinely concerned about my well being. She was a little absent minded but that's what I loved about her! Softly humming tunes while trying to track down information, "talking to herself" when she found something ("oh! There it is!" etc)  It made me feel at ease.
I don't know why the reviews are so bad for this place... I've had an amazing experience so far.
As someone who suffers from varying mental disorders, as well as being victim to multiple emotional & sexual traumas, I find it exceptionally difficult to trust; yet I already trust Dr. LaRussa. It's such a relief to finally meet a mental health professional who can see me for who I truly am, and that I'm comfortable enough around to be myself.
Even though he's a psychiatrist, he listened to my rambles and my talking in circles. He offered practical theories, and gave solid advice.... And he seemed to really understand me, suggesting we find a therapist to treat my PTSD. He spoke to me like I'm a human being.

I've only had one appointment so far but Dr. LaRussa is sooo fantastic! He and the rest of the staff seem to genuinely care about the patients. I look forward to my next appointment with him.
If you're someone who's easily threatened, this man is the doctor for you! I've met so many, and none even half as compassionate as Paul LaRussa. His gentle smile alone would make anyone feel at ease.

name: ben guthrie
text: Jennie is great! She's helped me tremendously.

name: Janice Mutchler
text: Inefficient, no regard for customer's time. Waited over an hour to see Dr for a scheduled appointment. Another patient in the waiting room with us signed in and waited an hour and a half, asked what the problem was and only then they figured out her appointment was scheduled for the following day.

name: Amy Westmoreland
text: Dr. Morr and her staff have been so helpful to my friend who was here on a business trip from France.  I appreciate that they were professional and reassuring to him. They went the extra mile to help us get him home for Christmas!  When he arrived back on a second trip, they saw him again, and he is already feeling better.  Thanks for everything.

text: I tried to explain to the lady at the counter that I could not read the paperwork she replied sorry I can't help you

text: This place has horrible customer service.They could have walked outside and seen me sitting there, but they wanted to make excuses! I waited for 2 hours and they said they tried to call me, but they had listed my phone number wrong and I was just in there last week and they had my right number on their chart!

name: Ellen Mannon
text: My husband and I both had a wonderful experience with Dr. Morr and the staff at Scottsboro’s Urgent Care. Everyone was kind, helpful, and professional. We won’t hesitate to go back next time we’re under the weather!

text: The staff and doctors are great very caring and had so much compassion i passed out in office and they took great care of me and made sure i was ok before they released me

text: Mrs. Nora the nurse is the best!!! Great service and great people 🙏🏼

name: Lindsey Michelle
text: Best customer service! I’m not from Scottsboro but visit often and was attacked by a dog and bitten pretty badly. I googled the closest clinic and ended up at a FAMILY clinic who TURNED ME AWAY 35 minutes before closing because they “didn’t have time to see me”. She showed no concern for the severity of the bite and told me to go across the road to the Urgent Care Clinic.... best thing they could have done. It was 25 minutes until close and the Urgent Care got me right in and treated the bite marks. Me and my boyfriend felt horribly for showing up so late and apologized multiple times. The response I got from Urgent Care was “don’t apologize, and we are thankful that you chose us.”  The staff there is extremely professional and super sweet! They were very aggressive with the treatment to make sure it didn’t get infected and explained in detail what signs I needed to look for if it worsened. I HIGHLY recommend Scottsboro Urgent Care and will definitely go back if there is ever a need.

name: Haley Davis
text: I went to see Dr. Bodiford for help with my ADHD and instead I was told I'm "too smart" to have ADHD via an IQ test, and I must only have dyscalculia instead. After going to another psychiatrist for a second opinion, I was told I absolutely have ADHD and that IQ tests are not at all a way to determine if a patient has ADHD. I went three years before seeking this second opinion, and in those three years I have struggled with my ADHD more than ever. I am so thankful for the ADHD Clinic in Hoover because Alabama Psychiatry failed me.

text: I had to edit my review because after dealing with them for a few years, this is what my experience is.(This review is for the main office on Sydney Curve.) They've forgotten me more than once, letting others go back to see the doctor before I do. Back before the old office manager left, I asked them for over a year what's going on with my daughter's copays. I couldn't get a straight answer. Their billing department has been a hot mess. Saying one thing, doing another. They let a large bill rack up and now she can't see the doctor for her meds. The doctors/therapists are great but billing and the receptionists (except Quintella) are a disgrace to anyone in customer service. I'll be so glad when they're paid off. I don't recommend them to anyone. You've been warned...

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review MedHealth Urgent Care. We are very sorry for the inconvenience regarding our temporary hours. We hope to return to our normal 5 day a week business structure however at this time both of our physicians have battled personal illness and have had to dedicate full-time hours on the front lines taking care of COVID patients at the local hospital. MedHealth wanted to provide some type of availability to our community. We thank you for your patience during this difficult time.

name: 2k tips
text: So sitting in the waiting room of St. Vincent’s Blount waiting on my appointment. All of a sudden the receptionist, patients and staff are running screaming at me to run down the hall. They scream over the intercom code silver. I get up and start going down the hall. The first waiting room I came to was x-ray. The staff inside locks the door and I’m tapping on the window to find out what’s going on. Just so happens I know one of the woman working there. A gentleman asks her if she knows me and she replies yes. They slip me a note through the door telling me to call them in 15 minutes. I hear a woman inside say get forceful and tell him to leave. I turn to look down the hall and every soul is gone except for me and the man who stole a gun out of a car in the parking lot. I had no idea where he was. No one would help me or tell me what was going on. I was locked out in the hallway that is at least 80 yards long by myself with no means to defend myself. The man was obviously sick and out of his mind. I saw him when I pulled up and he gave me an uneasy feeling. I was not scared for me but thought to myself what if an elderly/young woman or a child walked in the door behind him what would they do. The only thing I could think to use to defend my self was a chair that was sitting in the radiology waiting area. I said to myself he will probably shoot me but hopefully I can beat him enough with the chair that he couldn’t hurt anyone else. I was starring down the hall waiting for him to walk/run towards me and I was going to do my best to stop him with a chair. Another thought I had was if I had my gun on me I would at least be in a better position to defend myself. Luckily the police got there and disarmed the man. I was so mad at the hospital staff for telling me to run down the hall and then locking me out of EVERYTHING. I was nothing more than a target at that point. I could understand their policy a little better if I hadn’t been waiting for 45 minutes in the same chair they ask me to flee from while rushing other patients into offices to protect them from a possibility bad outcome. I asked the Administrator what was the big plan for me. Wait till he shoots me then scurry on over to the E.R. All he said was this is not supposed to happen here. Needless to say I am extremely, extremely disappointed in the way St. Vincent’s Blount handled things today!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Complete negligence for patient care!

name: Kandi Warnock
text: I have had a bad experience with Dr Little every time I have been seen by him. He has horrible bedside manner , seems like he does not want to be there and you are wasting his time. I was sent by home health  care for fluids due to dehydration from Dysautonomia, he proceed to say here drink Gatorade , I politely told him I am allergic and he still insisted it was what I needed. I have Dysautonomia and require IV fluids , if Gatorade and water worked I would not be coming to the ER. It is a well  known fact that in the area,  he is a horrible doctor, most call friends to see if he is on call and avoid to go if he is there. I can say being an Army for many years , seen dozens of doctor’s he is the absolute worse I ever encountered. You have a 50 percent chance of getting a good nurse.

resp.text: Hi, we always appreciate the opportunity to improve, and we’d like to talk to you more about how we can do this. Please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) when you have a moment, so we may discuss your review. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text: Family member admitted for extended stay for rehabilitation due to repair of broken hip. I spend 5 days here helping care for her. I am so impressed with the kindness, compassion and all around professionalism of the staff. The sweet folks that cleaned the room did excellent work. The dietary staff staff were so quick to bring a different item if we asked for it. The meals provided were well prepared and delivered with a smile. The RNs were precious: Madison, Haley, & Hazel showed pure loving care and were so patience even when we seems to be pressing that “call button” every 5 minutes. The case manager went above and beyond to keeps us informed about what needs we might have in the future. There is an obvious Godly spirit guiding the workers and medical staff here at St. Vincent’s Blount. I will never forget the kindness and love shown to my family. And they have free wi-fi.

resp.text: Hello Lynn Wray Dillard. Our hospital aims to deliver the highest quality patient care. We love to hear about these positive experiences. Thanks for sharing this feedback with us!
