name: Mr.bones
text: I went there because my knee was fractured and they said because I can move it there's nothing wrong and then they x-ray my wrist

resp.text: We work hard to provide high quality of care. We would like the opportunity to work with you directly regarding this review. Could you please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) at your earliest convenience? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Johnna Battles
text: I absolutely love this hospital. They are always quick to respond to you and you or your family member is made to feel comfortable. The staff are always polite and friendly. The only time I have ever seen them be rude to anyone is when the patient demands medication for pain and tries to tell the staff how to do their jobs. Great Doctors and short wait time.

resp.text: Johnna Battles, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at St. Vincent's Blount.

name: Allison Dickinson
text: I received 10 star care in the ER recently while getting care for food poisoning.  They got me back quickly, awesome Rn got IV on first try (and I was dehydrated). Everyone who entered my room was very helpful! Even the lady who took my insurance info brought me warm blankets! Thank you for making an awful night a little more tolerable!

name: Genie Biondini
text: I have relied on this hospital for 12 yrs. This is a super place. Down home place, and everyone that works there has a heart. This entire county+ replies on it. I recommend it to my Mom, she loves it.

resp.text: Genie Biondini, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

name: Amber Allen
text: I would not suggest this hospice company to anyone who cares about the terminally ill patient. Our nurse hasn’t answered our phone calls on the first call yet. Thankfully my father was only on hospice 5 days before passing on. The morning he passed, we couldn’t even get someone to answer the “emergency” number. I got in touch with an operator and she transferred me to another extension, who  didn’t answer either. My father passed at 9:30am on a Thursday, so anyone who has a loved one pass at an odd time of day my heart breaks for you because you will be looking at your deceased loved one for an extended amount of time. Once my father passed (at a rather young age) naturally my mom wanted the hospice bed out of her living room. On day two after his passing, we called frequently throughout the day about the equipment being picked up, after being assured it would be. At 6:30pm on day two, my husband called again to ask when the equipment would be gone and the lady said not today and hung up on my husband after he explained to her the equipment would now be outside for them. This is not the kind of experience you want when losing your father.

name: Laura T
text: Wish I could give 0 stars. The staff is very rude and quick to judge. They screwed up on me multiple times where I nearly lost my life and family members as well that have been there. If you want your life saved DO NOT go here. They deserve to be shut down. Maybe that will happen one day.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Pandi Bear. Please email us HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can address your concerns.

name: Meme Jones
text: The service has been great for my mom. Rated a three for the quality of the food in cafeteria and how expensive it is for food. Having to pay full price for three meals a day gets expensive. Wished they had at least a discount card for sitters that stay with loved ones while they are in hospital. We help out a lot in caring for loved ones to make it easier on you guys. We should be able to afford to eat here while we stay. Disappointed.

name: Brandi Underwood
text:
If I could give no stars, I would!
I went to the emergency room there yesterday burning up with a fever, chills, sore throat, body aches, ALL FLU SIGNS. I was aching so bad I was in TEARS. They didn’t run a flu test, they pretty much laughed at me and told me to take some ibuprofen and sent me home. So I knew I had the flu and decided to go to boaz Er where what do you know, I was burning up and I have the flu.

I’d seriously hate for anyone deathly sick to have to go to Oneonta emergency room because they would just laugh at you and send you home to die.

Sorry but if you can’t thoroughly check out your patients and give them correct treatment you do NOT need to be a nurse or doctor. I wish I knew how to call and properly complain on them.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Brandi Underwood. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Lee Hardin
text:
The wait time in the ER wasn't too awfully bad.
The staff was very nice to my mother and my family.
My only real complaint is the hospital looks and feels unclean.
The place generally just feels and smells nasty.

People friendly for the most part.

resp.text: Lee Hardin, thanks for taking the time to leave your rating. We'd like to learn more about your experience. Would you mind sending us an email to HospitalReviews@Ascension.org with your contact information?

name: Shannon Trammel
text:
The place smells dirty and always has leaks.
Some of the staff in different areas are genuinely nice while the others are very rude.

I don't see that it is managed very well but it never has from what I understand from older family members.

When I have to come for anything, I feel like a cow being herded.
It's disappointing having to go to Birmingham because we live here.
Sad

resp.text: If there is feedback you'd like to share, feel free to reach us at (205) 939-7264 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm). We're always open to feedback as it helps us improve. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Brandon Barkley
text: Legit one of the worst hospitals out there. They would sooner let you die than actually treat you. Avoid this hospital if possible

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case. Please call us at (205) 939-7264 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so we can address your concerns. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Polly Nix
text: Unless you are about to drop dead, you would be better off driving on to Birmingham. They are soooo slow! I take my elderly mother here for care and we always have to wait. Most of the doctors come up from Birmingham anyway. I don't think any of them ever look back at their records, we have to fill out the same forms and have had the same test run numerous times. Just try not to get sick in Blount co.

name: The Stuart Yeager
text: Bad experience in admissions  dont belive they even attempted to file with insurance company was billed excessively for labs that insurance should have covered. Do not go here and get ripped off. Lady in the lab was great. Would not recommend go somewhere else that's interested in you not how much they can shake you down for.

resp.text: The Stuart Yeager, we'd like to look into your experience. Would it be possible for you to email us your name, details and date of visit? You can email us at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org. Thank you!   St. Vincent's Blount Community Manager

name: Avery Nichols
text:
Some of the staff in E.R. and Med Surg are very rude. They are definitely not attentive.

Place always feels nasty to me, smells unclean, public bathrooms are messy, and patients rooms do not get cleaned like they should.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Avery. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns.

name: Chris Mahan
text: They gave me great service at a reasonable price. The staff and doctors are caring people who put the patients needs first.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience, Chris Mahan. Listening to our patients is important to us.

name: Dalton Wester
text:
I had two  heart tests scheduled with the Birmingham Heart Clinic at St. Vincent's Blount as well as a stress test to be done at St. Vincent's Blount on April 29th.
I reported to BHC for the two heart tests and was told the tech who did the tests was not available that day for some reason.  I came back to the hospital later that morning for my stress test.  Heidi did the stress test.  She learned that I had been unable to complete the other tests by the BHC tech that morning.  She said that the hospital had had a cancellation that day and asked me if I wanted the hospital tech to do my tests to save me another trip.  I agree and she called and set up the other tests for me and they were completed in a timely manner.  I wish to commend Heidi for the  way that she handled my stress test and also for going the extra mile to get my other tests handled the same day.

resp.text: Dalton Wester, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

name: Janet Holloway
text: They need to ask for the visitors information when patient goes in the back room

name: Shannon Nappier Reynolds
text: My son went in with a very itchy rash that kept spreading. He was sent home with prescriptions for three different diagnosis. He visited the health department with a friend and was diagnosed with scabies. Recently a close friend has had several abdominal pain, she was told she needed to loose weight after waiting 8 hours to be seen. I rushed my son to the ER for sizures he's started having with his diabetes he could barely walk. I was told had I called an ambulance they could have got him straight back sooner for us to take a seat. Thirty minutes went by and I had to show myself to get the nurse to come to the waiting room. The nurse flipped out when his sugars were so low that the readings didn't register. The lady at the desk just acted as if she just hates her job.

name: Chy Goodwin
text: Would give 5 if nurses came around to check up on patients a little more often!  Usually don't see anyone (unless i call, that i don't like doing for everything little thing) sometimes 3 hours.   Great, friendly, and caring staff!!

name: kimberlina68
text: Been here twice for outpatient services Radiology and Lab. Love it.  ***Edited because ER Dr Little is horrible, he does not even do any appropriate testing. He is so concerned about not Admitting anyone, under any circumstances. Then BILLING is making huge errors, BALANCE BILLING which is Insurance FRAUD!!

name: James C
text: St. Vincent's Blount can now change the name to The Place You Go To Die just like the old hospital. They let another person die in the emergency room. My Friend would still be here if we could have gotten him to another hospital. You get a 1star because that's the only way I can post. Also I took my wife there about a year and a half ago we sat in the waiting room for 6 1/2 hrs only to be billed by the Dr. for treatment we never received. We are planning to report the Dr. To both Medicare and Medicaid and BC/BS for false charge's because the Dr. Refuses to fix the Bill.

name: Jairren Siffles
text: Anytime I've had to go they have been great and I'm there for an hour at the most

name: Pat Pate
text: LONG wait to get into ER . When finally in Dr Thomas was rude, unprofessional, uncaring after 6 hours we got to go home. Not even sure if her diagnosis was correct. Definitely won't go back if she is on call.Everyone else was kind no complaints against any nurses or aides.

name: Alicia Mena
text:
Came in about 1am, empty ER. Taken back immediately for my five year old.

Nurses were curteous and nice. However, Dr. Scott 'I'm an arrogant prick' Davidson seemed, very unconcerned about my daughter.

Ordered Blood and urine analysis and CT, milk what you can from Medicaid, I guess.

It's currently 4am, and still no type of diagnosis or input from the doctor.

It's reasons like this people avoid hospitals🏥.

name: Kyle Willis
text: Last time I was there I was there to be treated for severe burns due to a trash fire explosion, came in and admission took forever and was told to wait in the lobby until I could be seen. I had to keep a cold towel on my burns for what seemed like an eternity. Should be shut down

resp.text: Hello, Kyle. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns. We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case.

name: Amber Woodard
text: Horrible place. Took my 5 month old daughter to the er last night for screaming and running a fever. Also mentioned she's had ring worm for 2 months now and her pediatrician won't prescribe her anything else. Doctor told me to change laundry detergent because that's how it spreads.😂😂 will never go there again.

resp.text: Hi, Amber. Thank you for taking the time to share this information. I have forwarded this comment to our leadership. Please feel free to send your contact information and any additional details to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

name: Susan Spiker
text: I have brought my sons to this ER multiple times for stitches, broken bones, and a concussion over the past few years.  We have always been treated nicely and have been in and out in a timely manner especially since this is an  ER and often someone with something more serious comes in while you are there.

name: Tony K
text: Old lady at the ER check in needs to be educated on dealing with customer / patient asking questions before checking into ER !!! Just kept insisting that my wife sign in, sign in, sign in WITHOUT ANSWERING MY DAMNED QUESTION !!! Asked if they had an Catscan or MRI. She didn't know but really wanted us to check in to generate a bill for my insurance. Bad Old Lady 😈!!!

name: Dolly Munster
text: There needs to be a negative rating. Long waits. Rude staff. Incredibly noncaring doctors. Dirty facilities. People deserve better than this.

name: Donna Segers
text: I have been sitting in the ER for 3 & a half hours waiting to get my foot x-rayed.  Dr came out in the waiting room an hour ago and said they were going to get it x-rayed soon so I could have results if I ever do get in a room...still nothing. No triage no x-ray nothing going on 4 hours!!

resp.text: Hi, Donna. Thank you for taking the time to share this information. I have forwarded this comment to our leadership. Please feel free to send your contact information and any additional details to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

name: Timothy Hacney
text: have not been able to stay awake for days and nights, high temp, unable to eat. i am a diabetic. my sugar levels  have been 121 or lower for months. the first thing Dr Thomas asked was if i was diabetic. I said yes, she then replied " Therein lies the problem" . I have never known my sugar to cause me to run a fever of over 102 degrees. This ER is a JOKE and been for as long as I can remember. he Dr came back and said my sugar was fine that I needed to schedule a appointment with my PCP.  needless yo say I left saying a few choice words that the whole er could hear.

name: Melissa Graves
text: My mother has COPD and it has been acting up and she has been coughing severely. I took her in yesterday to the er and all they did was give her a breathing treatment, prescribe her a steroid, and send her home. The only reason i took her there was it is the only one in the county. NEVER going back.

name: Brittany Schaffer
text: Horrible ER! Do not waste your time coming here. Waited for over 5 hours in the waiting room while my husband had chest pains. By pass this hospital and go to East or Downtown!!!!

name: Debbie Bellamy
text: Physician and Nursing care excellent, friendly staff.

name: Jaida Johnson
text: The biggest joke of a hospital that I have ever seen. Don't waste your time here.

resp.text: Hi Jaida Johnson, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. If you are willing to give us another chance, please contact us at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can understand your situation better in order to try and turn your experience around.

name: Eric Hunter
text: One hr an forty-five minutes after arrival, that's how long it took before they took my wife's vitals. After that, we were sent back into the waiting room for another long wait.

name: Candy Donovan
text: I will die at home before I go back to this place. This hospital is a joke.

name: HeatherL
text: I did wait for 3 hours for the whole process to get in, get treated and on my way out. But I also had Netflix to occupy me.

name: Joshua Jackson
text: My girlfriend sat there for three hours and all they gave her was instructions on seeing a primary care physician. Throughout the night her coughing and sneezing got worse and her throat hurts even more, she has almost completely lost her voice. She is clearly sick and they didn’t do anything for her. We will not be back.

name: Zachary Bennett
text: Broke 6 bones in my foot/ankle and the doctor refused to see me a second time, but charged me $640 to wrap it in an ace bandage. Very horrible people

name: Raymond Kenna Jr
text:
Had an appointment for 3:50 pm , signed in at 2:20pm.
Finally got called back to exam room at 4:20pm.
Doctor came in exam room at 5:06,
saw his patient for a total of 5 minutes

name: Crazy Gamer
text: I wish that I could give a negative rating we have been waiting on the doctor for 1 hr 45 minutes in the room and the doctor has been sitting at his desk not moving at that time

name: Britnie Owens
text: Rude staff members!!!

name: Paula Valdez
text:
(Translated by Google) They take a long time, and that
That it is an emergency, one dies there

(Original)
Tardan mucho, y eso
Que es emergencia, uno se muere ahi

name: Camella Hollaway
text: I was charged $65 for a Covid test. After receiving my results, I shared with the doctor, my symptoms. He stated, “It’s pollen.  You have sinus problems.”  He never examined me.  He then stated, “I will call in a prescription. Which pharmacy do you use?”  The prescription was never called in.  I am so disappointed.  Please be advised this is the third incident I’ve encountered with this doctor and this facility. I’ve documented each incident and will act accordingly.

name: Melvin Morton
text: Outstanding! correct diagnosis felt better one hour after getting two shots and my prescription.

name: Wesley Griffin
text: Took my mom there today and we were the first people there but ended up being the last to be almost seen had to leave without being seen but all the white people were seen. Very disappointing and will never return. And i will make sure nobody i know will go there.

name: Curtis Watts
text: Helped save my life

name: Tanika Wagner
text: I have made 2 visits at Urgent Care Selma within the last 6 months and the service was AWESOME. I was very please on my last visit which was for a stomach virus and I was beyond satisfied with the service provided besides just giving me prescriptions. I was treated with IV fluids and felt so much better after leaving. Kudos to the Urgent Care Doctor & staff...

name: Quita Mack
text: If your business states you close at 6, why close 40 minutes early just because it’s slow. I had just spoken with the office receptionist and was told they stop seeing their last patient at 5:45, just to arrive at the office to be told they closed early.

name: Russell Pardue
text: 2 hour and 35 minutes is a little much to sit and a urgent care. Btw I’m still here

name: Kathy Alexander
text: Fast, professional and the staff along with doctor were  wonderful. Glad that they are convenient.

name: Vanessa Brown
text: Dr. Nam and the staff at Urgent Care are all amazing. You are in and out in no time.

name: Barbara Gilmore
text: good and friendly  fast service

name: Suwanda Lewis
text: Amazing care and treatment

name: Tarnisha Thomas
text: Awesome staff

name: Melinda Boggs
text: I was referred to Dr. Crowder-Hicks after open heart surgery in 2018. This lady is a fantastic doctor! Bedside manner is awesome. Personality like none other. Just a genuine, good person. I would highly recommend her.

name: Lesia Feagin
text: Dr. Crowder Hick, is my sleep apnea doctor, thanks to her treatment plan I can actually sleep at nights without feeling drained and a pounding headache every morning.  Very best at patient care.

name: Brenda Sheppard
text: The best Doctor ever

name: David Chambers
text: Everyone was welcoming and friendly.  Not in a rush, which is crucial for me.  Great staff.  Even got to talk "Harry Potter" with Gretchen.  Jennifer was thorough and SUPER kind.  The Doctor (Renee) was a complete professional without being aloof. A great experience.  I will return and encourage others to give the new crew a chance.

name: Marcelus Joseph
text: Absolutely amazing. The new staff is so much better. They take care of you and make you feel comfortable and at home. The wonderful ladies who took care of me were Madison, Rene, and Gretchen. I highly suggest everyone come here.

name: Marissa Lycans
text: This was my first time going to UCM and I was very impressed. The NP was super friendly and so was the staff. I was in and out in 15 minutes. The NP had my diagnosis and prescription within 5 minutes. The only negative is there wasn’t a purse holder on the back of the door in the bathroom. I would recommend UCM!

name: Krista Graham
text: Very nice from phone call to when I got there til the time I left. Very knowledgeable and worked with u to make ur visit easy and smooth.  In and out in no time as a walk in. The front desk, nurse,  and doctor was on the same pg and a very nice staff. I enjoy going here and very reasonable pricing.

name: Geri White
text: The staff is friendly, quick ,and efficient at UCM.  I get seen within several minutes.  The doctors and Nurse Practitioners have always diagnosed me correctly with correct medicines to resolve the issue.  Excellent facility...very clean and modern.

name: Heather Rice
text: I loved how quickly they got me back and seen by the doctor. I let them know I only had a short time until I had to be at work and they were very accommodating. The office was very clean and had a friendly atmosphere. The doctor made me feel like he was my friend and truly cared about me. I would definitely recommend this doctors office!

name: Maddy McKinney
text:
UCM

Very sanitary and clean environment. Caring and nice staff. I come here every time when I am ill and the doctors listen and care and try to get the best medication for you.

name: Robin Jones
text:
I went in and there was no wait... I got in and got out ! Ms. Jennifer and her team were AMAZING ! I do not normally rate business but this Urgent Care patient care and customer service deserved 5 stars.
If I was to make a recommendation, I would love to see some modern upgrade.

Thanks Team 😊

name: ANN PETTUS
text: I had the pleasure of being seen here today. The Staff was amazing and so kind. I was in and out they jumped right on my issue. Which was severe pain in my right wrist. I got grays that came out good and the Dr resolved my problem with 2 shots. 5hrs later I feel great no pain. I definitely recommend!!

name: Billie Jo Flowers
text: I was very disappointed in doctor even though I had been there several times in past year. Without divulging my medical problem,  they should and do have my medical history. The nurse seeing me before doc seemed to be more aware. Poor bedside manner. Done with this place!

name: Samantha Booker
text: I came in today as a new patient, I waited only approximately half an hour including the time it took to fill out the paperwork before being called to the back. The staff was very kind and professional. After being taken back my vitals were taken immediately, a little while later the doctor came in and introduced herself and got right to what is going on with me, called me in a prescription for my antibiotic and hot me right on out there for door. I was here maybe a little over an hour altogether. I will come back in the future and I definitely recommend to anyone else in need of urgent Care.

name: Josh Hiatt
text: I had an awesome experience at UCM! The staff was professional, very competent, efficient and thorough. I highly recommend.

name: Rick Jaramillo
text:
Waiting in lobby for three hours. Then into waiting room for 30m at least now. Here for sore throat, staying here til I'm dead apparently.
*Update* still waiting and probably contaminating this room with my sick. Also noticed the window is bordered up with plastic patient gowns taped to the window frame.
*Update* nearing hour four still waiting in my cell to be seen. Getting pretty hungry.
*Update* apparently walking out of your cell and asking how much longer earns you to be seen immediately by the doctor.

name: Madisen Molitor
text: I really enjoyed this place. The staff was very friendly and funny. They got me right in and explained everything very well to me. One of my favorite urgent care places.

name: Travis Eberhart
text: This is my third and final visit over the past year.  Pay close attention to your bill whenever you receive it.  They will often charge for items never conducted or agreed upon.  The wait times are ridiculous and the doctors are not very knowledgeable on common illnesses. They will automatically order lab tests ran despite having a correlating symptoms for those tests. I went in for the last time today with complaint of a sinus issue and they ordered abdominal X-RAYS to be conducted with lab tests on Strep, flu, and blood work.  I asked to speak with the doctor and they just asked me to leave the office.  I wish I would have read these reviews prior to ever coming to this place.  Again, pay close attention to your bill.  They charged me for a specialist co-pay instead a normal office visit co-pay.  I asked the lady at the front desk what "specialist" I was seeing and she stated that the owner of the clinic was a Pulmonary specialist and that is the reason why they are allowed for the increased fees.

name: Brother’s keeper
text: Had a great experience @ UCM. It was fast and friendly. Was in and out within one hour. Will be back for sure!

name: Brien Dickson
text: I was treated at this urgent care and had a very good experience. The front desk receptionist provided courteous and professional service from the moment I walked through the door.  I had a TriCare prior authorization which they accepted without issue. The nurse practitioner who took my vitals and history was equally pleasant.  She provide excellent care.  The Doctor capably provided his diagnosis and treatment plan.  All services were efficient and clearly communicated. I would have given 5 stars had they accepted an alternate id number besides my ssn.

name: A Google User
text: Do not go here! I have been twice now, once last year for a severe case of flu, and recently for an STD test. Last year when I had a bad case of the flu, I went, and was assured that insurance would cover the shot they gave me to get better. A month later, I got a bill in the mail. When I went for the STD test, they took my copay before seeing me, took my pulse, my blood pressure, and then took me to another room where they told me that insurance might not cover the tests. They then tried to give me a shot and a prescription for some pills. I refused, as I had not had a test, let alone a test that came back positive. They wouldn't refund me my copay, and told me to hold on to the prescription "just in case." This place is a scam designed to get your money. NEVER GO HERE!

name: elogrl
text: This is the WORST Urgent Care. I have ever been to. It’s a dingy office. The receptionist said she couldn’t pull up my insurance information. I called the insurance company and they gave me the exact membership number that was on my card. I also asked the receptionist if she needed to speak with them. She told me it was not pulling up and she would call them. She told me she called and they were closed as if I lied about calling. I called back and put the insurance company on speaker phone in front of people in the office to prove my innocence. I handed her my personal cell phone for her to complete my paperwork. I have never been through this much to see any doctor. The care is not urgent either. I came in at 10:30 and left at 1:05. There was only 2 people in the lobby ahead of me and 1 other patient that walked out of the back. The Practitioner came in and didn’t even introduce herself. ( Angela Gann ) She gave me my diagnosis and asked me to come back for a follow up. I told her I won’t be back and explained the situation. She gave me a dry apology. She went to the front desk and started talking about me. My door was open. I heard everything. I addressed the Nurse Practitioner letting her know I heard everything. The nurse that checked my weight said make sure you tell them in the review that you told her what you wanted prescribed. I told her I would. There’s absolutely nothing wrong with me suggesting the medication I would like to be treated with. The staff is not friendly or professional.  Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

name: Janelle Wassell
text: I have taken my son here several times and have been happy each time. UCM staff is friendly, courteous and the wait time is more than acceptable!

name: Kelly Redman
text: I got there at 5:10 on a Saturday afternoon.  The doors were locked but the website says they are open until 6 pm.  The girl at the front desk never even looked my way.  I noticed all the times have been removed from the door.  So, I drove over to American Family off Nance.  I arrived at 5:35 and was seen quickly.  I won't even bother trying Urgent Care next time.

name: de vida loka
text: Great place. Front desk is very nice, NP is great and Gretchen is a fantastic nurse.

name: Austin Marsh
text: We waited for 2 hours just to get back and an hour to see the doctor only to be prescribed over the counter medications that my wife has already been taking. I made him aware of the medications she has been taking and that they were ineffective. I called to request a different prescription and they refused

name: Kara Pleasant
text: They were very quick but no one was in there. Staff was friendly, but everyone seems to be unsure of themselves. Also,.recommend they get a female nurse.

name: Sarah Stimpson
text: This is a great office with a wonderful caring doctor. The office is never full and I am always seen very quickly.  Highly recommend!!!!

name: Derek Hunt
text: My Doctor was very knowledgeable and my experience here went well. Plus they got me in and out. UCM

name: Scott Simmons
text: My name is Scott Stiles. I am a Google Maps Local Guide (Level 6). My experience allows me to attest that the bad reviews of this place are real and genuine, not fake or manipulated. The public vetting process that is Google Maps reviews has exposed a bad apple in the local community. Consume a portion of this apple at your own risk.

name: Rachel Rozelle
text: They took me back immediately. The staff was friendly and helpful. The doctor seemed knowledgeable. They definitely resolved my problem.

name: Jon Bryant
text: This location is sluggish and slow with getting results back. I'd recommend going anywhere else when it comes to getting tests done. Buyer beware

name: George Barnett
text:
Their website states their open until 730pm M-F...
I went in at 655pm on Friday night and was told the doctor refused to see anyone after 630pm.
I have a chronic condition that needs attention at times but, this doctor couldn't be bothered to
take what would have been 5 minutes of his time to see a patient in need or URGENT CARE....
Too bad, what a way to present your business to Madison and the surrounding area.

name: Leeanne/Aaron Brown
text: Dr. seemed nice and knowledgeable however it took almost four hours from in the door to leaving.  Sitting with a badly sprained foot in a waiting room chair was not a pleasant experience.  If the least bit crowded, go elsewhere! Do not wait!  They are VERY slow.

name: Melitza Tonn
text: This urgent care has hours listed from 730am-7pm. We arrived at 6:10pm to be told they have taken their last patient for the day and will not be seeing any me patients. They made no exception for the fact i was there due to a severe cut on my finger. I was told they would reopen tomorrow at 730am and to go to an E.R. Why post hours that you are open until 7pm but so accepting patients at 6pm? Change your hours or make it clear that you stop taking patients at 6pm. Very unhappy.

name: Chris Dale
text: This place is great. You can get in and out rather quickly and the staff is amazing.

name: Dharmendra Kumar
text: Review is related to billing. I went there for preventive checkup. I asked them multiple times before visit and they assured that they handle preventive visits. They claimed to insurance as sick visit and insurance did not page as I did not have copay. I got a big bill for single visit and they were not ready to correct the bill after many follow up. I ended up paying from my pocket. Will not recommend anyone to go there as they gave me wrong info during visit

name: Grant Baker
text: Rudely turned down a 3 year old with a 103 fever at 5:30 PM, despite being open until 6:00pm.  The nurses and dr were behind the counter laughing about as my child suffered.  As fast as I could, I went down the road to to another urgent care (AFC) that also closed at 6:00.  They gladly accepted us at 5:58!

name: Jasper Kigar
text:
I'm going out of my way to complain in order to warn people. Pick your red flag: A). It's a reconstituted bank complete w/drive thru windows, B). Vomit stains on the lobby carpeting. C). Teenage receptionist who did not make eye-contact, doesn't know basics, and doesn't care.

These flags caused my sick self to not trust the care I might have received, and walk out untreated. I felt like I was in a less-developed country, to be honest.

name: Whitley Dawson
text:
Went in for cough and shortness of breath early morning on 4/7/18. This was my 3rd time here over the course of 2 years, the previous times I sought treatment here the experience had been fine. Long story short I was given only amoxicillin for my cough, ear pain, shortness of breath and congestion. When I asked for something for my severe ear pain I was told to take ibuprofen. The diagnosis was an upper respiratory infection. After 3 days of taking the amoxicillin my symptoms got worse and the ear pain didn’t go away. I went to a different urgent care center where they did a full work up and told me I had bronchitis. They gave me a steroid shot, z-pac, inhaler, steroids, ear drops and cough medicine. I’m not sure if they are afraid to prescribe medication at the other place but I will not be back.
A month or so ago my sister was in a car accident. She went to the urgent care center of Madison where they attempted to do an x-ray but they didn’t have someone experienced with the equipment as they took x-rays of the pillow and other places other than my sisters back. After exposing my sister to all that they referred her to an imaging center. They also sent her home with ibuprofen.

name: Katie Phonthibsvads
text: My husband went in for back pain . The doctor thought it might be sciatica and was going to schedule an MRI. 4 weeks later my husband called wondering what was up with the MRI. He was told they called to make an appointment but didn't know what time to make it for so they didn't schedule it, instead of calling my husband to see what time was good for him. He told them schedule it for whenever and the nurse said she'd she take care of it that day . 5 days later and nothing. I went in to see what was up. The doctor that my husband saw no longer worked there and she had to get the MRI approved by another doctor. Then they had to clear it with our insurance and she'd get an appointment for the next day. It's been 2 weeks now and still haven't heard from them. I have an  appointment with another doctor who will hopefully be more reliable and more professional than urgent care.

name: Sean Lovell
text: I went in on Labor Day and despite it being a holliday they were very fast, thorough, and friendly!

name: Erik Lakso
text: I will never go here again.  Ever.  An hour before they close we were turned away by the staff despite the waiting room and parking lot being empty.  Ended up spending 4 hours at the emergency room because they wouldn't spend 15 mins to check out someone in severe pain.  This place will NEVER get my business.

name: S Sidney
text: Update on my HORRIBLE experience. Visited the office Wed. Was diagnosed with a muscle spasm given a shot and 2 sample muscle relaxer medications and was told by Dr Dyer to let her know if the meds worked because she would call a prescription in. Meds seem to be providing some small relief,which is better than none. I call Fri, speak to "receptionist" Ashley, let her know I'm needing the Dr to call the prescription in. She tells me she'll let her know when she gets back. I ask if someone (the Dr, a nurse or herself) will call me back & notify me that it's been done. She says yes. 2 hrs later, still no return call, I call back to follow up. Ashley informs me NOW that the Dr won't be back until Mon. I let her know I'm in pain today and want to see if any other Dr is able to call script in. She says she'll ask & I'm told AGAIN someone will call me back. No one calls. Saturday I call a 3rd time, get Ashley AGAIN. Immediately ask to speak to a nurse. She doesn't put one on, instead wants to take a message AGAIN. I inform her this is my 3rd time speaking to her and was ensured I'd get a call back the 2 previous time and NEVER did. She simply states "we're kinda busy". OF COURSE, hrs later still no return call. A friend calls from her phone, Ashley answers. She ask to speak to a Dr. Ashley takes a message. My friend received a return call from the Dr in office NOT 10 MINS  LATER. I however, have called 3 times and NEVER ONCE RECEIVED A RETURN CALL. Never again will I spend any of my money in this place and I will tell EVERYONE I know to avoid them at all cost. The way the conduct business is REPREHENSIBLE!

name: Paula Spicerkuhn
text: I have been to this clinic twice over the last 18 months or so, on weekends with my doctor is closed.  The first time I was waiting on my new insurance card, so they gave me all the paperwork I would need to get reimbursed and each time they have listened to me.  This last time I had trouble at the pharmacy so I called them and they offered to call the pharmacy again.  It turned out the pharmacy was having phone problems.  I went back after the first time because of a good experience and will continue to use them when I need to get in on weekends.

name: Heather C
text:
Experience is very hit or miss here although the nursing and front desk staff have been great. This is the only urgent care in town that will accept my sons' insurance, so we came here early last month when he had the flu. That diagnosis went fine, and he was better in a few days. However, my husband started experiencing symptoms within days of my son. We came back here thinking it would be a simple diagnosis and they would give him a Tamiflu prescription since they diagnosed my son. However, they performed a flu test that came back negative (too early), refused to give him Tamiflu, and told him he needed to be seen by another dr if his symptoms got any worse. Because of this, we ended up in the ER the same night and were told at that time that is was too early for him to have a positive flu test. $800 ER bill later, we received the Tamiflu prescription. Urgent Care of Madison could have saved us money and time, but they would not even write a prescription for Tamiflu after diagnosing someone else in the family, and now they are sending a bill after doing nothing.

This is not our first poor experience here either.

name: Jim Williams (CenterFade)
text: Friendly staff that really makes you feel at home.  Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Kelly McGlynn
text:
I had an ingrown toenail and no insurance.  I was told my flat rate was 125, yikes big price.  But I paid it.  I was second on theblist and arrived right when they opened at 7:30. Had to wait about thirty minutes to forty before I was called to an examination room.

I sat there from 8ish until close to 11. I was told over and over again the practioner would be right with me.  It was freezing in that room might I add.  I was also tested for a blood infection cause of my toe.  She finally came in a little after 11 and examined my toe. I figured she would be able to cut along the side straight down.  I was told then and there she was not certfied/cleared to do such a procedure.  This confused because it is listed on their site they can treat ingrown toenails.

It was treated and it was painful.  I was told the proper care,  Ina small dose.  But what really surprised me was the lack thereof of a bandage. No ointment was placed on it after it,  but a guaze and a single bandaid was placed on my big toe.  It did not stay on long and started to peel off after an hour,  thus more infection invitation.

After that ordeal,  I go to pay and I am hit with a twenty buck charge for my blood work.  I was confused because I had no blood taken from me.  No, it was the prick they did and I was not told at the time it'd be another charge. So I did not appreciate that.  Nor did I appreciate the fact it was 145 for just a blood pressure and pulse check,  examining my toe and clipping?/ draining it and a prick ob my finger.  Nor did I appreciate waiting for so long when I was the second to arrive.

Also,  when I exited I saw many people dressed formally talking down the hall and outside blocking the path to the doors.  Thus,  they were blocking the way for possible elederly and/or people with special needs. I was told they were busy and hence why it took so long.  I heard people come and go through those hours I was in my room.

Anyways,  she did what she could and did help my toe some and the pain has died down  but i was over charged and unfairly charged for the blood work. The employees should inform their patients what and why they are being charged. So no i am not coming back and dont reccommend this place for urgent care.

name: Benjamin Khammar
text:
This urgent care clinic is very quick - you are in and out in a very timely manner; unfortunately, they don't bring anything else to the table. The nurses are instructed to run order tests (technically under the doctor's orders) before the doctor actually speaks to or looks at you -  this happened to me multiple times. Each time, a nurse has told me that the test are "protocol" and I can't turn them down - after I signed a patient's bill of rights, containing a clause stating that a patient can refuse any medical care - which is federal law. I had to argue with a nurse to turn down a chest x-ray for a minor sore throat. First, I asked why- she said that it will detect bronchitis. A quick google search told me that it bronchitis shows up on a chest x-ray about 25% of the time. It also informed me that I didn't have any symptoms of bronchitis. Turns out that they also ran a completely unnecessary white blood cell count test, which the doctor told me would not have affected his treatment, regardless of the result (after the fact). The doctor actually looked at me after this ordeal. He was able to tell me that I had an ear infection after a 2-minute physical examination. None of the three protocol tests were in any way necessary.

In a separate incident, there was another minor sore throat that had persisted for 2 weeks, accompanied by a couple bumps under the tongue. The nurse followed protocol and said they were running 3 tests, including a strep test. I declined this, only to be told in an extremely rude manner - by a different nurse this time -  that it is "protocol" and I can't change protocol. I reminded her that her protocol is internal, and it can certainly be deviated from. In fact, it is federal law.

My insurance company was actually billed for the 2nd incident (I was billed for a small portion as well). I went to the office to request a refund for myself and my insurance company - only to be told by the head nurse that they can't do it. Of course after digging deeper - she literally meant that they can't refund, but their billing company can. This was only the beginning of the battle of semantics. She also told me that she I can't speak to her manager, because she is the head nurse and the manager. After discussing further, I learned that she does have a boss (surprise!). She finally agreed to email him/her and have them contact me the next day. That was a week ago...

Please understand that this is one of the most important factor in rising health care costs and boycott this place. I have also been to North Alabama Medical Care in south Huntsville twice, and although they do try to pull some BS- it is not nearly to this degree. They actually have the doctor look at you before running unnecessary tests.

name: Bryant Keller
text: Dr P is a wonderful doctor that truly cares about his patients.

name: Tammy Coonfield
text:
NEVER GO ! EVEN PHARMACY NOT IMPRESSED WITH THEIR KNOWLEDGE of what they prescribed me AND SERVICE.
URGENT Care Madison Sullivan St.
They were not busy at all. Now understand why. Have bronchitis told dr over counter cough med was NOT WORKING . COUCHING keeping me awake and huurting in my chest. Was told giving me a liquid cough med and pill cough medicine decongestion and antibiotic and an antibiotic shot . Went to pick up prescription at pharmacy only pill cough medicine. Called them they called pharmacy to get straightened out. I called pharmacy they said it was an over the counter cough med insurance would not pay. Get it off shelf. I called Urgent Care back explained she said no that is not correct . URGENT CARE spoke to pharmacist and then called me. I then called pharmacy again. The pharmacist stated that neither the two employees she spoke to INCLUDING  NURSE EVEN KNEW THE MED that was prescribed to me and that she THE PHARMACIST WAS NOT IMPRESSED WITH THE URGENT CARE STAFF and NEITHER AM I OR MY HUSBAND.

name: Carol Foster
text: Not so urgent.   I waited 4 hours when there was no one in the waiting room.   They wanted to talk about everything besides what I was there for.   X-ray tech was incompetent.   I waited over 6 weeks to get info to file with insurance even though I called the same afternoon, and had to call and remind them after 4 weeks.   2nd piece of info was promised to be ready to pick up. I was left waiting AGAIN so they could collect Co -Pays from other patients sitting in the lobby even though my Information was laying under the counter and could have just been handed to me.  Avoid this place like the plague.   ER would be faster and less hassle.

name: April Zimmermann
text: Don’t waist your time if you’ve got an infant. My insurance company suggested I bring my sick 4 mo old here ASAP. Upon arrival was told they didn’t have a nurse practitioner present that could see a children under 3 years of age. Save yourself the hassle and go across the street to the Urgent Care off of Ivory Pl.

name: Steven Sims
text: DO NOT GO HERE!!! Insurance did not cover my visit because Urgent Care doesn't bill as an office visit and had to pay $140 out of pocket + medicine costs for routine visit. They would not adjust or change billing so insurance would cover after several calls.    I have used other "urgent care" such as American Family Care numerous times with the same insurance and never, never had to pay more than my co-pay out of pocket. I have BC/BS.  I will not be back.

name: shelly moo
text: I am EXTREMELY greatful for the Dr Benjamin Fabvis( sorry, if spelling is wrong:-) ) who helped my mother. It was truly a matter of life & death for her. And for that I will be forever greatful. With that being said, I hope & pray we don't have billing issues like other patients according to the reviews.

name: K Pax
text: Waiting for at least an hour for something as simple as a prescription.

name: Kimmese Smiths
text: Terrible service. after seeing a nurse we had to wait 2 hours before the doctor came in. The front desk nurse gave us dirty looks when we asked how much longer we needed to wait. Will never come back.

name: Shawn Sullivan
text:
When I first went to Urgent Care, I had a good experience. Unfortunately, I developed Thrush when I was put on strong Antibiotics. I called when I discovered my tongue was covered in white, and i was told that I didn't need to come in, that they would just phone it in for me. I waited a few hours and nothing.. I called and I was told it was phoned in. I asked them which prescription was phoned in, and when she checked my files, she said "Oh, it hasn't been done yet.."  I was assured someone would call me back in 30 minutes, which didn't happen. I then called back in and was again given the run around.. I told her I expected an update ASAP, and if they didn't have one, I'd call back in. Well, needless to say, they didn't give me one. I called back at 4pm - almost 6 hours after my initial call and was told "it's in the doctors file and they're waiting for him to approve it, which he will in between patients.." The next day, at 11am, I called back to find out what was going on. I was then told that the doctor that was now there didn't feel comfortable prescribing me an anti-fungal cream because of the legal risk - like I'm going to be freebasing Nystatin?!? They gave me two antibiotics, including Levoquin.. How could I not develop Thrush? All they cared about was getting my $$.. No one bothered to call me once. I had to call them a total of 4 times to eventually be told that they wouldn't help me unless I came in.. The irony is I OFFERED TO COME IN ORIGINALLY AND THEY TOLD ME IT WOULDN'T BE NECESSARY!!! They wasted my time.

MDVIP - Here I come. I'll pay money to get someone that cares, and not just trying to pack in as many patients and copays as possible.

name: Colleen Noletto
text: This Urgent Care was advertised as being open till 7pm. I arrived, sick, at 6:30 pm. I was turned away because things were "slow" and they decided to close up shop early. Will not be back. So unprofessional.

name: Thai Huynh
text: Worst service ever. They will not see you unless they feel like it. 3 hours between getting into a room and actually seeing somebody.

name: Robert Turner
text: this is the most horrible place to go to!!!! I will never go there again . the staff was horrible and the nurse practitioner was worst. The wait was forever and the staff was not nice and i could hear them complaining about  pt's in my room. Very unprofessional staff.

name: Peggy Cobb
text: Madison Urgent Care opens at 7:30 a.m., I'm the only person here and after 30 minutes, I'm still sitting in the lobby.  The Doctor and staff just got here.

name: Machelle Naulty
text: Wanted to charge $30 for a flu shot even if I had insurance.

name: Joseph Oberlander
text: Front office staff was unprofessional and the doctors tend to be in a hurry and do very little to diagnose. Had to go to another clinic.

name: Janna F
text: Terrible experience. Office billed with incorrect diagnosis code, and services were not covered by insurance. I've been calling every week, and their "billing" department states they will call me back but never do.

name: Brian Stewart
text: They claim to open at 7:30 so I get to the parking lot at 7:25 and am the only one here.  Staff begins to rolll in about 7:35, doors don't get unlocked until 7:45.  Finally make it to a room at 8:10 and don't get to see a doctor until 8:50.  If the 7:30am open time is your selling point on this location, don't bother.

name: Jonathan
text: This place is no longer in business

name: Tristan Myles
text: WORST PLACE I EVER BEEN TO. WAS THERE FOR 3 HOURS AND DIDNT EVEN GET WHAT I NEEDED!

name: BOBEYR HIALL
text: Worst service ever, took 3 hours just to get in a room!

name: Michael Jones
text: They are a walk in clinic and refuse new patients after 6 even though they're open until 7.

name: Amber Yell
text: The Staff is very personal and friendly. Really Listened to me and the wait was not long at all! We be going back!

name: David Keel
text: Thanks for the warning.

name: Kimberly Gibson
text: Staff is rude. Doctor nor staff read my grandmother's charts before they called to give me information on her care. Had to take my great grandma for the same test multiple times because they didn't do it right the first time. Staff do not call you back with test results. Still don't have results for a test they were supposed to run over month ago.

name: Katlyn Grubbs
text: The only thing I have a problem with is that the women who answers the phone is very rude as soon as she answers she sighs like shes having a bad day like she just dont want to talk to you and then says what can I do for you .idk kind of rude I feel like she could be more welcoming and better at answering the phone .

name: Laura Simmons-Ford
text: How is this place even still open? Anytime I’ve ever tried to go I’ve been told the doctor has already left for the day and I can’t be seen. Even during normal business hours.

resp.text: Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday are our short days. Tuesday and Friday are the best days to schedule your apt. Sorry for any inconvenience this may caused you.

name: Tiffany Weathington
text: This place deserves a O! I’m all about supporting small businesses, but I do NOT understand how this place is still a functioning business/Practice! Poor customer service starting from the front desk to the checkout desk... Never will return even though it’s convenient to my house.

name: maysen schur
text: This place has awful customer service....thanks to the rude lady at the front desk I now have strep AGAIN!! do not recommend at all....

name: William Bone
text: If you require medical assistance that is remotely mediocre at best, don’t go here. This urgent care center has poor performance across the board. I went to see Dr. McKitty today, because I was suffering from severe nausea, vomiting, stomach cramps, and cold sweats. I am severely afflicted by GERD, and flare-ups like these occur on a semi-regular basis. It took me over an hour to be seen by the physician, though there were only 2 people in front of me in line. All the while I was vomiting and losing precious fluids. When I finally got to see McKitty, she had a smirk on her face and a terrible attitude from the start. I patiently answered her questions, and then I told her about my history of going to urgent care centers over the years for these flare-ups. I told her that I am usually given a saline IV and a shot of Promethazine when I have these flare-ups. To which she replied, “I will not be giving you Promethazine, and you can leave and have a refund if you don’t like that.” I was appalled by the rudeness of this exchange, but more than that I was in shock that this person claims to be a doctor, yet clearly has no fidelity for the Hippocratic Oath. I spent the rest of the day fighting nausea, dehydration, and cramps all over my entire body. I was able to get Promethazine, which I am prescribed, from my family when I got home, but it took over 9 HOURS for me to stop vomiting and be able to get food down. I needed the Promethazine in shot form, which is why I go to Urgent Care centers across the USA. I’ve been to at least a couple dozen of these centers over the past 7 years for these flare-ups, and I have NEVER been turned down for wanting Promethazine in order to relive my nausea anywhere from South Carolina to California. This is hands-down the poorest example of attempted competency that I’ve ever experienced anywhere.

name: Melissa
text: When you call for appointment,  the girl on the front desk will say "Doctors are all on vacation " then she hangs up on you! If i could give this place i "0" i would!!!

name: Bubba Ex
text: This place is the worst doctors office in this country. And run so horrible. Everyone is so rude. The lady at the front got mad and hateful because we paid the copay with a $20 and she had to walk next door and get change. The lady that done my moms blood pressure and took her information was so rude because my mom can't hear well and the lady wouldn't speak up where she could be heard and she was so rude and disrespectful. We was the only ones in the doctors office and it took almost 3 hours before the doctor finally came in, just to be rude as hell to my mom and call her a liar, literally. I'm not a doctor by far but I can read this doctors charts better than she can. And not that long ago my step son came here because some issues with his shoulder and the doctor here at Alexandra had x-rays done and comes back and says nothing is wrong with his shoulder and then she sends him to do therapy. Well his pain got worse so we took him to get another opinion and the other doctor done some x-rays of his shoulder and come back in and said it's pretty clear that a bone in his shoulder was shattered and he needed surgery. This doctors office here in Alexandria is the worst in every way possible and then some. This place should not even be open for business. People come here for help. And with every person that is on this staff does not need to be in this field. I know I've said it but this is the worst place ever.

name: Angie Brannon
text: Wonderful staff, thorough exam, really listens to the patient. Speedy service, too.

name: Robin Brown
text: Rude staff, doctor only works when she wants to so good luck catching her in the office. But....if you need a refill (on bp meds you've been taking for years, let's say) you have to see the doctor (that's never in the office). I think I'll just find another doctor.

name: latasha kirkland
text: This place staff was so rude. I sat in the empty waiting area for a whole hour and never talked to anyone behind the corner never completed paperwork or nothing. This place is a none professional establishment and should consider hiring a new staff. I will continue to follow up on this business because people should not be ignored when seeking medical attention.

name: Katrina Renforth
text: Staff is so rude!! Been dealing with them for 3 days because of refill. WHY...would you work somewhere and have such a bad attitude.

name: Pam Curry
text: Mom went to the ER because of symptoms related to COVID. She was admitted pretty soon after being seen and ended up in the ICU unit.  The nurses in the ICU were awesome!   Especially Hunter. He was her nurse for 4 days of her stay with them.  I never got his last name,  but he treated my mom and I both with such compassion and kindness. She got really good care while there.  I finally got to go in the hospital and see her on her last day with them and it was small and clean and really nice.  I recommend this hospital.

name: Nivada Spurlock
text: I am a huge fan of Dr. Sophia Lal.  As an athlete, my goal is to never miss a workout.  Dr. Lal understands that mentality and takes the time needed to be sure I'm in a safe place for returning to physical activity.  The staff in her office made my visit pleasant and efficient.  Highly recommend Dr. Lal for your ortho needs!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We are happy to see these comments! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Dianne Varden
text: Dr. Worthen is the best all around of any doctor I have seen as a patient. He is very courteous, easy to communicate with, has time to listen and very knowledgeable. I have had three knee surgeries by him and each time he has shown concern and compassion. I highly recommend him and his friendly and helpful office staff!

resp.text: Thank you for this great review, and have a fantastic day! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Becky Garrison
text: Kendall Roper is an excellent health care professional.  She clearly communicated the problem and offered different solution options.  Also, she was extremely patient and willing to answer all of my questions.  I would recommend her to anyone.

resp.text: Hi, thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Carol H
text: Dr. Worthen and his staff were very helpful. He discussed options with me and answered any questions I had. He has a great bedside manner, shows compassion and takes time with his patients, addressing their concerns. I would recommend him to anyone looking for an orthopedic doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We are grateful to be able to deliver compassionate care for all. We hope your day is great! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Jim Geiger
text:
This is a first class hospital.
Everyone is friendly and professional and you can tell the staff loves working there.
I feel respected and well cared-for, here.

resp.text: We think we have an incredible staff too! They work hard to deliver compassionate care. It's always nice to see messages like this. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager.

name: Nicole Roper
text: Everyone was so nice! I would highly recommend this orthopedic office! Dr Roper was thorough and answered all my questions without being in a rush. The front desk ladies are the sweetest and the x-ray team was super fast!

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback! We will share it with our leadership. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Elaine Chandler
text: I visited Dr Bowman’s office to receive an X-ray  & a cortisone shot in my left knee. His staff was very polite & courteous. Dr Bowman is a nice, no-nonsense type of guy. He explained the X-ray to me & his nurse gave me the shot. Due to the use of lidocaine, the procedure was quick & not painful at all. I would recommend Dr Bowman to anyone w an A+ rating.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: michael thomas
text: Dr. Worthen operated on my shoulder. I had zero pain in the days to follow. He was extremely thorough. The nurses and all the staff was top notch. Dr. Roper was great also and I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We work hard to provide high quality care. And we are committed to delivering compassionate care to the community. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Tim Gaither
text: Dr. Kissel is the absolute best! Very thorough and upfront about everything involved. His wealth of knowledge and experience is second to none.I feel very fortunate to have had him as my doctor. The whole staff is amazing as well. I have been extremely pleased.

resp.text: Thank you. We appreciate your positive review. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: allison mims
text: Everyone we came in contact with (check in, nurses, doctors, and checkout) was so kind, efficient and patient! We were very pleased with our visit.

resp.text: Hi, thank you; we appreciate your feedback! We will share it with our leadership. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: lynn huffstutler
text: Sara Thompson, nurse practitioner with St Vincent’s Orthopedics, is great. I’m so glad a friend told me about her and Dr smith. I went in to the practice with knee, hip and now back problems. Sara along with Dr Smith has helped me so much. Sara is so nice, pleasant, knowledgeable and prompt when I go on my appointments. I rarely have to wait to see her and she always makes me feel comfortable when discussing my problems. I trust and have faith in what she tells and prescribes for me to do. Thank you Sara.

resp.text: Our care team aims to deliver high quality compassionate care to the community. Thanks for sharing this feedback with us! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Maggie Stafford
text: It a very nice visit from seeing Ms. Brandi to seeing  Dr. Kendall Roper. I highly recommend them!!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. We will pass it along to our leadership team. Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Janet McDonald
text: Dr. Bowman is a wonderful doctor. I would recommend him for your orthopedic needs. He has been so understanding and takes time to listen to his patients. I had a total knee replacement and he did everything to help me to  get back to my activities.

resp.text: Thank you for these comments. Your feedback is important to us and we will pass it along to our team! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Sharon Denson
text: Although I prefer to see Dr.J.Todd Smith since he's been my orthopedic doctor before he ever moved to St.Vincent's.  Sara is very efficient and listens to your feelings. They have done outstanding surgery's on me in the past. They all make a good team. I highly reccomend them all. Thank God for these gifted surgeons. Thanks for everything ya'll do.

name: Ezma Collier

name: Emily Kunkler
text:
We visited this wonderful hospital from out of town tonight as we were passing through to go to Florida for our vacation. My almost 4 year old was having an allergic reaction to something he shouldn’t have eaten and I have nothing but great things to say. We were greeted with a smile from the person checking patients temps at the door. Walked directly to the desk to get checked in and met another smiling face. Next the nurse doing vitals was very nice and friendly.  Our nurse Aida was SOOO sweet to my little boy and even gave him two prizes for being so good. He was so excited to give it to his brother when he got back to the hotel. (Reminded me of the old days when I went to the ER 25 years ago and got a stuffed animal that I still have to this day.) Dr. Gore was in the room before I even had time to sit down and was very kind, reassuring, and professional as well! Our little boy was okay too. Given some Benadryl and we were back to the hotel within an hour of leaving.

This experience was a great example of what people and hospitals should be like! Thank you!!!!

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I will not be seeing Dr. Kissel again. Worse 'patient/dr. manners I have encountered' I have been having excruciating pain in left knee, sleepless nights and misery for about 3 weeks. He was highly recommended, upon arrival they made one front board x-ray of knee after I told them explicitly it was the right inside of left knee. I am a very healthy 84 yr old, just had raving reports from primary Dr. this week on my lab work, agility and very active lifestyle. Dr. Kissels words to me were that's an old 80 year old knee, some arthritis. Take tylenol and get an otc cream. I asked if it could be a torn miniscus he said probably but that knee is old with a lot of miles. No mention of mri or further ckg into it. I could walk 2-5 miles with no limp before this onset, don't take pain pills, have not been admitted to any hospital since 1976 ,clean my own gutters, horseback ride etc. He repeatedly referred to my old knee. Well I plan to use these 'old knees' for several more years to play t ball and dollhouse in the floor with my great grands. Needless to say I cancelled my appt. to go back in two weeks, I heard him loud and clear about my old knees.  Love St. Vincent's Hospital this is totally about the one doctor.

text: The only reason I went there was it was late Sunday night and I was very sick.  We only waited in the waiting room 10 minutes, in the other room about 15.  Girl came in, asked symptoms, said I had a sinus infection and she would prescribe something.  Left and never came back.  Total interaction, less than 3 minutes.  Tech came in and gave me a stack of paper work and said I could go.  No verbal instructions, nothing.  Came home and read stack of paper to find out a list of things I was supposed to take/do.  All they prescribed was Amoxicillin.  8 days later, still terribly sick.  The most ridiculous part was they billed my insurance $3090 for a 3 minute visit, that I found out was only a PA, not even a doctor!!!!!  I won't EVER go back there!

name: Clarence1957
text: I cannot thank the staff of this new hospital enough. We were in our way from Indiana to Florida when I started experiencing stomach pains. For 3 hours my husband drove while I vomited in the back seat. It just got worse. He found this little hospital and I did wait in a gurney in the hall for a few hours but there were no open rooms in the ER, and although I felt like it I was not dieing. Tests were run and IV fluids and meds were administered. I was admitted and had to spend the night but I really am thankful for the ER Dr and nurses who helped me. I was treated with dignity & respect even though I was not an "ideal patient" (pulled my IV out once). So if you are in that area and need help, don't hesitate to go to this hospital. Thank you again for the excellent care and love you gave to me in my time of need!

I had questioned the nurses & Dr. Why are we still here at 12:35 & she still don't have a Damn bed here nor in Shelby County.. They told us her condition was critical but she still laying in this bed.. One the nurses tried to be sacrastic with me about how long we been out here, her name was Olivia Shoemaker the Dr. was Dr. Elliette.. Im convinced that these people are only here for the money not to care for the patients.. This trully sad & this a new hospital fairly!! It's like what was the point of giving us a new hospital if your staff could care less..

text:
I went to St.Vincent's because the previous day Brookwood Baptist Shelby I had been diagnosed with multiple kidney stones.
They told me to come back if symptoms worsen, or new symptoms begin.
But because gas was low we reluctantly went to this facility. And once again got affirmation of the reasons why we should have not even bothered.
Dr.T as she is known  in the er, came in 35 minutes after I had been put in a room. And they were not busy as I went straight back, the bedside manner was hideous, the,nurses are rude one even has really bad,broken English you can't understand her words when she talks.
Anyway the doc came in, I told her about my hospital visit just yesterday and from that point she asked questions and we discussed it, she then listened to my chest and,back. Leaves the room about 15 mins after that a nurse (heavy Russian Accent!)  entered my room

name: Stephen “sknappster” Knapp
text: Service an attitude were great all staff were helpful and diligent in their cane.

name: Shay Jordan
text: So i have a cpl of foster children in my home and one had lice. We work all day so took our own children and foster children to get a perscription for shampoo to get rid of it before it spreads. The doc wrote over the counter shampoo (i explained it wasnt pay day and i could not at the moment afford to treat 6 children) and he flat out refused to write perscription strength so our insurance would cover it. (bcbs) He thought it better to just let it spread instead of actually assisting us to get it treated.

name: Stevie E.
text: Poorly managed is not nearly enough to say about this hospital. Nurses are getting their hours cut on a regular basis and then told they shouldn't be "in it for the money" by hospital administrators who cut hours because they're in it for the money. Hypocritical.

name: Johnathan Dopson
text: Literally the slowest hospital on this planet ive been here for 4 hours and no one else has been in here for the past hour and was told earlier that they had all the results in and now we're waiting for literally nothing

name: Wendylyn Geeslin
text: I can't say I'm not pleased... Had an abcess and with the swelling being so bad and omg did it hurt, my dentist sent me to the er for antibiotics. Gave me two high mg antibiotics And an injection of toradol for the swelling. Took a lot of Advil, picked up the antibiotics that morning by the afternoon the swelling was down and it felt soooo much better. Was able to get to the dentist and get it taken care of that Wednesday. Only drawback was this was on new years eve and the wait was from 6pm-11pm. Guess that's to be expected though sometimes.

name: Rosalie Pearson
text:
My mom lives in nearby Thorsby while I live in Montgomery. She called me at 11:30pm to say she felt lightheaded, a little dizzy, and had what felt like a slight pressure in her chest. She called the ambulance and the EMT's took her to St. Vincent's to be checked out.

I had left Montgomery immediately after receiving the call and arrived at the hospital minutes after her ambulance had arrived (the EMT's were just bringing out the gurney to their rig when I got there) I went into the Emergency Room, told them why I was there and gave them info on my mom (name, date of birth, address, phone, and reason for admittance). The woman told me they were going to get her in a room and then ask when I could come back. I was the ONLY person in the waiting room. About 20 minutes later she said again that they had her in a room and would see when I could go back. Fifteen minutes after that she said a woman had just gone back to see if I could go back. Needless to say it was over an hour before they let me go back. The worst part is that I had assumed they would at least let my mom know I was there. Even though she had been asking them and voicing concerns about how I had not yet arrived no one from the waiting room told her I was there and none of the nurses back with my mom bothered to check if I had arrived. This was not a far walk either, considering my mom was approx. 30 ft inside the doors from the waiting room I was in.

When I finally did get back to see her she was hooked up to a heart and pulse/ox monitor and they had a fluid IV in. They took her out to get chest X-rays and a CT scan minutes after I got back there. When she returned to the room about 15 minutes later, the nurse that brought her back first said she didn't know how to hook my mom back up to the machine and the IV...then was going to try...then decided no, she would have someone come in and do it. A half hour went by and no one came in to hook her back up. I stepped outside the door and explained that she had not been hooked back up and the nurse at the station said thanks, and they would come in and do it...which they never did. The original doctor she saw was also standing there when I told the nurse and did nothing. You would think if you were monitoring someone who you think may have had a heart attack you would want them hooked up to a monitor.

Finally, the doctor came in a little before 4am and said that the X-rays, and CT scan were just fine, but there were concerns with her blood work (PS no one had ever come in to hook my mom back up to the monitors). The doctor explained there are three types of cardiac enzymes. One that tells if there is actual muscle damage and that they use to determine if you've had a heart attack (which was normal and my mom did not), and two others. One of the extra two was normal and then the doctor said that the third was "significantly higher." She said that could indicate that although she may not have had a heart attack that enzyme could mean there could be something brewing or big That could happen on the horizon. She wanted to admit my mom so she could see the cardiologist in the morning...which we did. Kicker is when the cardiologist came in and looked at the tests he said it was slightly elevated, but nothing that he found alarming.

All in all I just felt like even though the ER was extremely slow, and at times there were 4 or more staff members sitting at the desk area within the ER, the overnight crew seemed fairly insufficient at simple things, like communicating that family members are there, or rehooking a patient back up to monitors and IV's.

name: Jerome Johnson
text: Went in for a toothache on a Saturday morning at 6am after being up all night with excruciating pain and they saved me I left in no pain from a dental emergency and I'm thankful to them because they are not dentist but they care enough to still help out

resp.text: This is great to see, thanks so much for sharing your rating! -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Jennifer Kimbro
text: great place!  Great Team

name: Sandy Driver
text: Love this hospital and the compassionate care that is provided

name: KBR
text: Great Hospital. Great staff.

name: Bobby Dees
text:
I love seeing NP Spencer and Dr.Johnson. The staff is great as well.

NP Spencer always takes good care of me!

name: James Wacenske
text: Dr Allen, nurse lorry are incredible. Very professional, prompt, considerate of patient needs. I genuinely love them.

name: Jason Carlton
text:
Usually I have a good experience here.  Not today, though.
I have a hernia.  When I spoke with the uab surgeon who did my other hernia surgery I was told if it wasn’t poking out it wasn’t an emergency and to go to my pcp or the urgent care to be seen.  She said if the pain got worse I could go to the ER.
Since I knew I wouldn’t be able to see my pcp on short notice I went back to the urgent care who told me to come back today and they could most likely get me into the Kirklin clinic to get imaging done the same day.  I showed up at 7 this morning and was the first in line.  I’m guessing everyone who worked there was late since they were late answering the phone (the woman came up about 705 and opened all the blinds before finally answering the phone even though there were several people waiting outside).  When they finally called me back at 718 I was told all they would do would be to send me to the ER.  This is after a UAB surgeon told me not to go to the ER. And after the urgent care told me to come back today.
The problem is that I now will have to wait hours in an ER, and I could have just gone last night if the urgent care was going to change their mind and refuse to help me.

name: Karen Witherspoon
text:
Everyone was nice. They actually helped me instead of just trying to push me out of the room (people who have had to go through the health system for years understand what I mean by that). The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because my condition is rare and the doctor admitted to not understanding it enough, but the honesty was much appreciated.
Edit : Slightly changing my review. My first review is still correct for my first visit. My second visit went a lot worse (different doctor treated me). She didn't care what about anything I said relating to what I came in for. She preformed an incision and drainage procedure with very little numbing agent. When I expressed this via my screams in pain , she didn't care. She just had people hold me down to the table. She proceeded to pack the area but i was in to much pain so she stopped and said "I'm not putting anymore because you don't seem to tolerate this part well (mentioned this part because in my discharge paperwork she said I tolerated everything well & there was no problems). After that she just walked out of the room and had the nurse tell me to leave. (The nurses were excellent just like last time). This particular doctor is who you want to watch out for because if you get the one I had on my second trip then I feel very sorry for you.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
